Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera, in and out of Water
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about five months and I absolutely love it. I wanted a waterproof camera so I wouldn't have to worry about ruining it in rain, snow, dirt, or anything else I throw at it.Here are some my favorite things about this camera:-It has a really fast shutter speed so it captures subjects in motion without blur.-It has a burst function that takes lots of pictures in a row, and so far they have come out incredible. I recently went cliff jumping and got some really good progressive shots of people falling in the air.-The camera has really good speakers when playing back video.-Picture quality is fantastic for a point and shoot, both inside and out. Some pictures taken in darker rooms turn out grainy, but that has happened with all my other cameras in the past.-The wrist strap is adjustable so it can be securely fit to your wrist while in the water.-The interface is really quick and easy to use.-The camera turns on incredibly fast so it's good for spur of the moment photo-ops.-You don't have to change settings between photo and video, you just push a different button for video to start recording. This is really nice because on my previous camera I often forgot to switch it back to photo mode and would take videos instead of pictres.All in all I love this camera. I don't have any complaints about it yet and I would definitely recommend it! I would also recommend buying a spare battery. The charge holds pretty well but if you are using it a lot in a day it's better to be safe and have a spare just in case. Wouldn't want to miss any great opportunities for a picture!TO ADD ON:I recently had my camera at the beach and someone dropped it in the sand. All the cracks had sand in them, so I was a little worried. I just filled my sink with water and sat the camera in in for about 10 minutes, and all the sand just fell off. It's like nothing even happened! I was so happy since my previous camera was ruined by sand.

Reviews.Title: Solid
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a few months ago after researching waterproof digital cameras and reviews extensively. The price has come down a bit from what I paid, but it was worth every penny. My camera has been in the water in San Diego, Cabo San Lucas, and Maui. It has survived in my boardshorts pocket while:Surfing - heard it knock against my board multiple timesbody surfingswimming in riverjumping off 20 ft waterfallHave taken video underwater with good quality. This camera is great. Hopefully it will last longer than my previous waterproof cam that was by a different manufacturer, but I didn't properly care for that one. I've been more committed to using the suggested maintenance procedures when using this one, like soaking it in a bowl of water after having it in salt water and keeping the seal clean with the brush they provide. The pictures are sharp and defined - high quality.In 7 days in Cabo I didn't have to recharge the battery once. I expect this camera to last for years.

Reviews.Title: It's okay, but has issues.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Burokas
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, that I wanted to like this camera. It was to replace my old and now, not working, Olympus SW720- a precursor to the "tough" cameras. That camera went through a lot and kept working, till the screen went white for no apparent reason, but I digress...This camera is thin & light. It has a 4x zoom (longer than my old cam). It shoots HD video (not SD like my old cam). It doesn't have a lens cover to jam up on sand, like my old cam. More resolution. Panny's "intelligent resolution" to ensure sharper looking images and "intelligent exposure" to brighten some darker areas. I looked forward to using it.But the image quality was not up to what I expected. Even bright daylight photos, with a forced flash to fill dark detail, when you look at the photos at 100%- the images just get muddy and undefined, they lack the detail I'd expect. In darker situations, image quality deteriorates pretty quickly. I tried forcing the ISO to 100. I tried letting the camera pick everything. I tried dropping the frame size in case it was "interpolating" to a higher resolution. Nothing helped. At best, some images are "nice" but none are great. Some suck. Several wee missed because the camera wasn't focused. I mean- on the beach, there's my boy, and the whole shot is out of focus. What did it focus on? I have no idea.The video is rough and heavily compressed. Audio is "eh." Audio in my old camera was bad too. I guess that's the nature of being an underwater camera. But why is the microphone on TOP of the camera when the lens is capturing something in FRONT of the camera.Battery lasted one day of occasional shooting, with more photos on the beach, but maybe 50 - 70 shots (I shoot a lot in a row when the kids are doing something interesting) total before I had to recharge the wafer-thin little battery. I admit the camera is thin, easily pocketable. Convenient. But that extra thinness also made it a bit harder to grip while my hands were wet. I'd prefer something chunkier. Then it could have a bigger battery.I tried to shoot a couple panoramas with the camera. It stitches and crops the image in the camera and, no matter what I did, the panos are very small. Maybe that's just how they are- lower resolution than actual stills. A lot lower resolution. Plus, exposure changes throughout the shot made it look weird. But I was impressed at how well it handled houses that would be "bent" because of the wide angle curve of the lens. Sony's in-camera pano mode has fared worse in this regard, but Sony delivers higher resolution stills and the exposure is locked through the pano. Also, Sony reliably gave me a pano each time (even if the pano sucked). The Panny would error out about half the time because I was going too slow, too fast, whatever. I don't know. As I didn't buy this underwater camera for panos, I don't hold that against the score of the camera.Lastly, there's two places you really expect to use an underwater camera- the pool & the beach. It was fine in the pool and the wrist lanyard was very good. But at the beach, when you get some sand on your hands because, well, it's THE BEACH... the sand gets under the shutter trigger and, again, I was missing photo opportunities because I couldn't press the damm shutter button. The video button still worked, but why would they not expect that SAND might be present at the most common areas on the planet where there's water- the beach.Some vigorous sloshing in the sea while pressing the shutter button worked the sand free and I was able to take more pictures.Pros:- small, lightweight, thin- waterproof, submersible- shoots HD video, big stills- can force the flash, can compensate the exposure, set spot focus/exposure, manually set ISO- has some scene modes that help a little with dark shotsCONS:- high resolution is lost when you actually look at the stills- video is grainy- a little too thin for my hands- debris can get under the shutter button preventing you from taking a picture- sometimes focuses on... nothingI really wasn't expecting DSLR-like quality, but I wanted better, and I wanted reliability, not missed shots. So I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Nice travel camera!
Reviews.Author: Kiael Long
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic TS20 digital camera for my trip and was very pleased!  The camera is made of mostly metal and feels very solid and durable. It is very compact and fits in my pocket without a problem, a big plus+ for traveling and wanting to avoid carrying a big camera.  Also, having this camera made me feel more comfortable about not scratching or damaging it because it is made to be handled without the 'white glove' treatment.  I'll get to the main point of having this camera; it does take really nice pictures -- outdoors / indoor and with good light. Night time pictures can be a bit tricky and you will have to play with the scene settings. Just like MOST small compact cameras, their strong points are NOT taking pictures in low-light situations.  Don't forget, this camera is waterproof and can take picture / video under water.  I haven't tried this feature, yet.  Will this camera replace a DSLR or micro 4/3 camera?  Not quite.  It will be a great in taking quick snapshots when you want to go out and not worry about carrying an expensive camera/equipment.  For example, going out for dinner with your wife/husband and/or friends.... IMHO you really don't want to be carrying any big camera ( I have a micro 4/3 camera and I think it is sometimes a bit big to carry in certain situations).  Did I mention that it fits easily in your pocket?  If you are looking for professional photos, this will not meet your needs. If you are looking for a rugged, all-around fun, waterproof and durable camera that takes great pictures, the Panasonic TS20 will fit your needs... especially at a reasonable price.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Lumix Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Turtle "War Turtle"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera after a lot of research on durable small camera's for my husband.  I was looking for a camera that took quality digital pictures of things standing still, moving objects/animals, and a camera that took quick pictures to get those moving objects.  I purchased the 32GB SDHC digital card for use, which was a little overkill, but it can hold over 4,000 pic's using the 16MB quality.Decision Points- Quality Pic's - from color to contrast is awesome.- Shutter Speed allowed me to get great pic's of objects moving clearly...to include a Tomahawk being thrown.- Easy to use, hooked right up to my MAC- Zoom for what I want to use it for is good, I will give up distance for the quality of pic's. (I would NOT recommend this camera if you are taking pic's of your child's soccer game and they are across the field, quality will be good but it won't be a closeup picture.)- Battery Power - I did not put the battery on a time; however, after a few days of taking pic's on and off through out the day I had to recharge the battery.  I plan on purchasing an additional battery.- I have NOT tested the waterproofing, I am sure my husband will drop it in the water soon enough to give a review on the waterproofing.  (Rated at 16Ft for 60min)- The camera is also rated at 5Ft for Anti-Shock Performance (again another good thing with my husband)- The camera is also rated at a temperature between 14deg F to 104deg F. This camera will be used anywhere from Alaska to Afghanistan so temperature variations was also a factor in our purchase of the Lumix.- It is a small camera that can easily fit in a hunting pocket out in the woods or in a combat vest pouch when deployed.Overall we are very happy with our decision to purchase the Lumix, it does everything we need it to do for our active lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: Died a watery death after 33 days
Reviews.Author: farul ghazali
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for a few weeks, the camera was used mostly in my Intex pool, never in salt water. Pictures taken in bright light were good, but in low light quality dropped off quickly.Unfortunately the camera just died yesterday, 33 days after I bought it and probably about 5-6 times after being dunked in a small above ground pool. The battery door was sealed shut, camera was never dropped yet it was clearly leaking as I could see moisture on the LCD. Overnight in a rice jar didn't help, the camera turns on intermittently and takes fuzzy pictures.Very disappointed. Trying to initiate a repair with Panasonic now.

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater camera!!
Reviews.Author: Christine31
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to the Bahamas, and I could not be happier with it. I wanted a camera that I could bring with me into the ocean and on the water riders to capture the memories. The camera lived up to its expectations. My underwater pictures and videos came out great. It was very durable and held up and I went on water slides and rapid rivers. The battery lasts long as well. I used the camera for 5 days straight and still have a charge. I would definitely recommend this camera for someone looking to bring the camera to a beach or water park!

Reviews.Title: Mine lasted 42 days - Panasonic Customer Service was Terrible!
Reviews.Author: wg
Reviews.Content: Pro: Great camera while it lasted, took great looking video, underwater stills, etc.Con: It died after 42 days - I jumped out of a sailboat with the camera in my hand, and when I got back in, there was water in the LCD.  I followed the directions for keeping the seals clean and making sure it locked, etc - maybe treading water forced some salt water in through the seals?Sadly I'll never know, because when I called Panasonic to deal with this problem, they told me that they couldn't do anything unless I paid $40 to have it evaluated at their service center.  They also told me that if it required repair, it might be $140 or $180 - the CS rep didn't seem to understand the silliness of that price for a camera that cost $139 brand new.I'm sad writing this review, because I've had great luck with Lumix cameras over the years, but this was really frustrating!

Reviews.Title: product description
Reviews.Author: Kimatthebeach
Reviews.Content: I could not find the list of contents in the product description.  I ordered a panasonic battery charger in addition to the camera.  Upon delivery, I found the camera comes with its own battery charger.  Contents include; camera, strap, battery, charger, CD and instruction booklet.Hope this saves someone else from the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Andrew K.
Reviews.Content: This is my first try at getting a digital waterproof camera and I need not look any further. The camera has been great! It has survived waterfall hikes, ocean waves, throwing back and forth between friends in a pool, and even diving down to about 15 feet during a snorkeling trip. Salt water was not an issue at all, just rinse and let dry. The pictures have turned out great (as long as your expectations are in the right place). What I mean is that if you want professional landscape photography, get a different camera, but if you want a durable camera for vacations to capture the essence of the memories that you are making, then I think this camera is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Smith
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our vacation to the Caribbean. We figured having 3 kids, a boat and a Caribbean vacation a tough waterproof camera would be a perfect fit. Our first day on vacation we were taking pics in the pool, after 20 minutes water somehow got in camera and ruined the LCD screen.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working during first use!
Reviews.Author: volleyballer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on our vacation, and we were happy with it at first - we just wanted something to take pictures under water while snorkeling. The picture quality looked good enough, it was small and easy to use. But on our first day it just stopped working while we were trying to use it. It wouldn't turn back on and we could see bubbles coming up from the case, which meant that it was defective, not actually water proof.We thought, oh well, better return it and just buy another one from a store - but we couldn't!  We were in another country and none of the major stores sold under water digital cameras. We were stuck the rest of the vacation without a camera.  Luckily the SD card was fine, but we couldn't take any more pictures for the rest of our trip.  Very disappointing :-(

Reviews.Title: casual shooting camera
Reviews.Author: whysea
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for 2 days this is my first impression on this camera:The picture quality is poor, but it is expected at its price. The good thing is that this is a 16 MP camera, so if you are not making a poster print, the quality is still ok; however, you will need a lot of storage space since the pictures are huge. This camera doesn't have the 60 second exposure time which the Lumix normally have.  The panoramic function is unacceptable and unnecessary since it already have a 25 mm lens.  At a glance the miniature effect seems cool, but this effect has nothing to do with depth of field, rather it is a simple process that blurs out the top and bottom portion of the picture to create such "effect".  The screen has an additional setting to increase the view angle from the bottom.  It is useful when you have to take pictures over head. However, the viewing angle from the top of the screen is limited so its hard to take pictures down low.  The zoom buttons are too sensitive when you are holding the camera with one hand.So far this is a good little rugged camera for casual shooting such as a day out at the beach, fishing trip, party, sport event, etc.  It is light, small, and fast thus allowing you to carry it through out the day and catch any moment of your choice.Con:-Image not as sharp.-useless panoramic-zoom button too sensitive-fake miniature effectPro:-25 mm wide angle-fast shoot-highly portable-waterproof

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: MattK
Reviews.Content: Used the camera for a week on land, and worked as expected. Then took it on a cruise, where on the second day of water use (less than 2 hours total beach time), the shutter and menu buttons stopped responding. Unable to take any pictures, I noticed water vapor behind the lens.Upon return to our cabin, I waited until the exterior had time to air dry, opened the battery door, and discovered water on both the battery and memory card.Even though I had taken care to ensure the door was closed and locked, even using the included brush to clean the gasket area, this camera was unable to maintain water resistance to 2 feet. While the body seems durable enough, the battery door is plastic, with a latch that does not seem to hold with much force. The quality of this part of the camera is lacking.

Reviews.Title: Horrid Service
Reviews.Author: AZWolf "AZWolf7"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures (I would give it a 4 star rating for this), but good luck if you need any kind of service on it, including what should be covered under warranty. My camera stopped working the first time I used it around water, and Panasonic refused to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: Brennan0624
Reviews.Content: We bought this specifically for our honeymoon and for it's underwater capabilities. My husband and I love to go snorkeling - nothing crazy, but some light snorkeling. We read the instructions, tested the camera before snorkeling and then decided to try it in the ocean. It lasted for about half an hour, took it to shore and heard a popping sound. Then the flash stopped working and there was a big blur on the digital screen and lens. What a waste of money - what part of "tough waterproof" are we missing?

Reviews.Title: Great camera as long as you don't use it in water.
Reviews.Author: drmaxdog
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic Lumix TS20 because I wanted a new Waterproof camera that took HD video as well as good pictures.  I know it only takes 720p video but that was better than my old waterproof Olympus Stylus 850 and the price seemed right.  I was concerned by the number of reviews that noted problems with water entering the camera but figured that it was a result of not following the directions or asking the camera to do things it was not designed to do. I have had my old Olympus that has probably over 12 to 15 hours of actually sitting in salt water and never had a problem so I kind of dismissed the reviews of water leakage.  I read the directions and played with the camera before my trip to the Caribbean last week and thought all was well.  Wrong!My first day on our cruise while in St. Thomas we were on a turtle snorkel and the camera failed in less than 15 minutes in the water.  I had placed a freshly charged battery and a new SD card and was ready to film some turtles.  I double checked the seal of the camera and thought all was well but after about 10 minutes or so I noticed some video noise on the LCD screen.  I swam over to the boat but now had no picture on the LCD Screen.  I opened the battery compartment to find some water inside along the SD card and battery. The boat crew laughed as they have seen this a lot. I got as much moisture out of the compartment as possible and wrapped the camera in a towel.  Back on the ship I dried everything out and reinserted the battery but the camera was gone.  The LCD screen worked in the menus and I could view the few photos I had taken but the camera could no longer take photos.  I was lucky to pack my old Olympus waterproof camera and it proceed to work well the rest of the trip adding another 3+ hours of underwater use.The Lumix must have a design problem because the seal looks cheap.  I was never in water deeper than 3 feet because we had to swim with a vest and didn't swim waving the camera in the water.  Comparing the older Olympus with the new Lumix water seal I must say that the Olympus has a much better looking seal and snaps down with some pressure.  The Lumix does not!  This is not a Waterproof Camera!I'd say if you want a camera that doesn't need to go into the water or is used in mist or light rain the Lumix might be worth a try.  I'm getting a refund and will try a different camera, most likely the more expensive camera and hope they have a better seal.Would have given ZERO stars because the camera claimed it was waterproof and it was definitely not.

Reviews.Title: Broken when we received it.
Reviews.Author: PublicSchool
Reviews.Content: We had to send the camera in to Panasonic for repairs - camera was unusable when we received it.  We paid for shipping to Panasonic, and now are waiting for Panasonic to repair and return to us.  In retrospect, we should have just send the camera back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Poor optical quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "professor k"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for my venerable Pentax Optio WP -- something I could stick in my pocket and use in the rain and snow, and on the beach.  It looked great on paper, and the price was right.  Unfortunately, the picture quality is terrible.  The center of the photo is reasonably sharp -- or as sharp as one has the right to expect for a camera in this price range.  But the picture becomes blurred as you go towards the edges.  On my camera, this was especially pronounced on the right side, with one-third of the frame unacceptably blurry. This is probably due to a poor quality or defective lens.  In short: if you like your pictures to be sharp, this is not the camera for you.  (OK, maybe I'm being a little unfair.  The battery life is good, so you can take a lot of fuzzy photos before having to recharge.)

Reviews.Title: Terrific Vacation Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically to take underwater pictures during our upcoming family vacation to the caribbean.  I was trying to find a camera where I wasn't spending a great deal of money, yet the pictures were decent(and hopefully the camera wouldn't leak).  I was a little concerned with how the camera would work out, but it totally met our needs!  I didn't purchase an extra battery and we did just fine with the battery the camera shipped with.  We took pictures and video clips both on land and underwater.  At the end of the day, I still had plenty of battery left.  It handled the salt water and the sand just fine.  The camera was easy to use and figure out. I followed the directions, and at the end of each "underwater day" I soaked the camera in fresh water for 10 minutes, shook it out a little bit, and let it sit on a towel overnight to dry out.  I did turn it a little bit from time to time as I walked by it in the evenings to give it a chance to drain from various angles.  In the morning, I would open up the battery area, and re-charge the battery while we were getting ready and eating breakfast.  Then the camera was ready to go again for the day.  The picture quality seems fine. (I usually use either a point and shoot digital camera or my iphone for pictures)  We've all (two teenagers and my husband) used the camera and been thrilled with what we were able to capture with it.  The response time is quick too.  We were able to quickly turn it on and capture fish and turtles as they were swimming by.  I did buy a 32g memory card for the camera so I wouldn't have to worry about taking pictures off the camera during our trip. We took a lot of pictures and videos, and still have a huge amount of memory left.  I'm looking forward to using this on our next beach trip later this week! I also purchased the yellow chubs wristband to go with the camera just in case we dropped the camera while we were snorkling.  That didn't happen so I really don't know if it actually floats, but the big yellow wristband made the camera easy to find whether in the beach bag or my purse!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic tough camera
Reviews.Author: ManBOOYA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife as we had a baby on the way and our other camera was missing the charger.  There are a few features of this camera I really like1. Takes pictures extremely quickly. After pushing power it takes less than a second before you can take a picture2.  Picture quality is great.3. Nothing protrudes from the camera the lens stays inside4. It is waterproof and takes decent underwater photos.5. Panoramic mode is neat and stitches the pictures together for youIt has a few features that are gimmicky as well.  For example it wil attempt to recognize faces and insert the persons name into the picture. This doesn't work consistently.  it has a lot of different pictures modes that seem odd as well. Like food picture mode and pet picture mode. I have tried them and they don't seem to do much.This camera was a great purchase and would totally buy it again

Reviews.Title: Tough One
Reviews.Author: Happypoppeye
Reviews.Content: I bought this little guy as a small, waterproof, fun, take anywhere camera. I haven't used a point and shoot in about 5 years so I'm mainly comparing this camera to Nikon SLR's (I know not a fair comparison at all but at least I know that). As far as image quality goes ...well, let's just say it's a fun camera. I recently put it through it's paces during Songkran 2012 in Thailand and even compared to my buddies Oly TG-610 ...image quality is horrible. Compared to my 5 or 6 year old Canon G7 ...image quality is horrible. Video is way too grainy also.That said, this is a 170.00 USD camera and it is just about the smallest, lightest, waterproof out there so it's just what I wanted. I was able to take shots in places I wouldn't even dare take the SLR. I was able to throw it around, give it to other people to take shots, keep it in my pocket and capture some great memories.Would I recommend it ...yes and no, as long as you know that it's a total piece of junk image quality wise ...I love the little guy though and will take it along next time, it's that fun. I also had no expectations and knew going in it wouldn't compare to much else out there but hey, it's fun, really fun, and cheap, really cheap. If your looking for the best IQ and such, well, this isn't the camera. If your looking for fun and memories, this may be your camera. Small, light, tough and above all else, well, fun.Bottom Line: it's $170.00 ...you get what you pay for ...and for that price, you get a camera that just works and isn't a hassle to carry.Oh yeah ...mini mode takes outstanding shots, panorama is quite interesting, and the whole iA mode is pretty much useless. I'm not sure why Panny doesn't just tweek the camera to make every shot come out with the colors and sharpness of the mini mode without the blur.It's a tough rate ...I'm giving it three stars overall. Fun factor is five stars. Picture quality is 2 stars. Video is one star. Peace of mind in carrying and using the camera anywhere and everywhere is 6 stars.July 30, 2012 update: ...the ts-20 continues to impress me and over the past few months I've taken another feew thousand pics with some very very good results. I can't stress how fun this camera is and for the price, I gotta bump it up a star to 4 ...$130 bucks right now with occasional drops to $119 ...it's a screaming steal at that price. I haven't used my SLR since I got it ...it's just too small, too fun and too worry free.

Reviews.Title: not as waterproof as I hoped
Reviews.Author: onlime
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, water got into this camera after using it on the second day at the pool during my vacation.  It did take wonderful pictures days prior though, but the main reason for my purchase was to take it into the water.  I have the first generation camera from the olympus tough series that lasted me for 4 years through snowboarding trips, snorkling, nights out, etc.  It still works, but I wanted a new camera with better resolution and better video functions.  I had high hopes for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great for Vacation!
Reviews.Author: CocoThe Slug
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for the sole purpose of getting some fun pool and snorkeling pics while on a tropical vacation, and it worked GREAT! No technical issues whatsoever. The photo and video quality are relatively poor compared to a SLR, but that's a given. My only gripe is that you need to remember to set the mode before you start shooting i.e. under water, sand and surf, indoor etc ... otherwise the white balance and exposure are a little off. Overall, a fun little camera.

Reviews.Title: This camera is TOUGH, and here's why...
Reviews.Author: Janna
Reviews.Content: This camera is a beast.  Not only does it take great photos, both underwater and above, but it survived a great ordeal.  I work at a remote fly fishing lodge in Montana, and was very sad when my camera slipped out of my breast pocket during and epic fly tangle rescue in high (13+ feet) early June water.  Only this last week did I get a chance to float the same section of river and attempt a rescue.  Sure enough, my Lumix was waiting for me (now only under 5 feet of water), perched on a rock ledge and just barely visible through the algae that had started to grow on it.  This camera spent 2 MONTHS underwater, and when I pulled it from what should have been it's watery grave, all it took was an hour of charging the battery for it to be back in full operating condition.  It works totally perfectly!  That, to me, is incredible.  Definitely consider this camera if you are looking for something that is truly tough enough to survive adventuring with you.

Reviews.Title: Water leaked in 2nd time using it underwater - DON'T BUY!!
Reviews.Author: Carla D.
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera last summer after reading many, many reviews.  We took it to Cozumel last July 2012.  We were very happy with the pictures and video this camera took while we were snorkeling.  We used the camera out of the water for several months afterwards.  We just took the camera back to Cozumel last month, and the first day we used it underwater, water leaked in.  We were extremely upset that we do not have pictures from our last trip to Cozumel.  My husband has searched for a replacement gasket to try to make the camera waterproof, but he has been unable to find one.  Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY IT UNLESS....
Reviews.Author: Matthew Regan "Matt regan"
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera unless you are running Windows 7 on your computer.  I Purchased one about a month ago and when it arrived I tried to upload the software on to my home computer but kept getting a "not compatible with this OS" message.  I was running Windows Vista, and despite what it says in the owners manual, it is not compatible with Vista.  I called tech support and got a case number and a promise of a call back, but none came.  Last week I bit the bullet and bought a new computer.  Once again I tried to upload the camera software but again, its not compatible with Windows 8...despite the camera being a 2012 model!  I called support again and they directed me to their website where there's supposed to be a patch, but none was found....ummmm errrrr perhaps we'll have a fix next month I was told.So, unless you have no need to actually see your pictures or share them, this camera might be ideal for you.  If you're like 99.9% of the population and want a digital camera so you can have access to digital pictures on your computer etc, this is a complete dud for non Windows 7 users.

Reviews.Title: Not really waterproof
Reviews.Author: jill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera explicitly for it's underwater capabilities, as I have a more expensive camera for regular use. I took it on a recent vacation to Mexico and began using it on the day we went to Xcaret, where we would be swimming, snorkeling, etc. I took a few land pictures and all seemed fine. Then we went into the water and after only taking 5-6 pictures, the LED screen went white and would no longer function. (Note: I had checked and double checked the battery door to make sure it was sealed tightly before I started using the camera.) I was extremely upset, as I would have no photos with which to remember this fun day. I tried pressing the shutter and the camera sounded like it was taking a photo, so I spent the rest of the day pointing the camera in the direction of what I wanted to photograph, depressing the shutter, and hoping for the best. I didn't know if it was working or not, nor did I really know what I would end up with if it did work since I couldn't see anything on the LED screen. Back at the hotel I removed the memory card and inserted it into my other camera to see if any images had been captured, and surprisingly, they had. So I was at least able to have some pictures from that day. However, the camera is really useless without being able to use the LED screen. Apparently, the camera isn't as waterproof as it claims to be. All I can figure is that it must have leaked somehow and caused the malfunction. I immediately sent it back to Amazon when we got home. Luckily it was still (barely) within the 30 day return limit, as I had emailed Panasonic and they seemed like they were going to be less than helpful.I commend Amazon on their quick response with my return. I had my refund almost immediately. I now plan on doing some further research and buying a better (probably Olympus) waterproof camera (one that actually IS waterproof!)

Reviews.Title: Great camera in and out of water
Reviews.Author: Irene G. Martinez
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera at Amazon about two weeks ago for my family's 10-day trip to the Dominican Republic. We used this camera to take great pictures and video in and out of water. I do not have anything bad to say about it. I read all of the other reviews for this and other comparable cameras and almost decided against buying any of them. However, at $130 and with Amazon's great customer service and returns I thought I had nothing to lose. I purchased it and I'm so glad that I did! This is a great travel camera as it easily fits into any pocket. We took over 800 pictures and about 1 hour of video with this little camera and they all came out great. I am not a tech geek or picture snob but I have got to say the it took pictures that are close in quality to my Nikon D3100 (which we also took on our trip). After seeing how great the pictures came out, we mainly used the Panasonic TS20 for the rest of the trip. I had absolutely no problems with water leaking or malfunctions of any kind. I simply followed the cleaning/maintenance instructions and cleaned the camera every night as instructed and it was ready to go the next day. It is now my every-day camera and have been using it in my pool with kids almost every day for fun underwater pics and video. Great little camera!!

Reviews.Title: Decent point and shoot. Wont win any awards
Reviews.Author: S. Mort
Reviews.Content: Had a run in with half a bottle of dr pepper with my old Canon IS and needed a new camera quick for a trip to Disneyland and birthday party. After having 2 incidents in 2 weeks with liquid damage on expensive electronics I decided to get something a bit more "weatherproof".I did alot of research for waterproof tough cams that apparently have just recently come back into vogue again. For the price you really couldn't beat the features on this one. If you wanted to spend 2x to 3x as much and pay for the Sony or Nikon they obviously have better picture quality, but for this price (I got it for $110 currently) you could not do better. Camera review sites seems to only factor in quality sans price. If price wasn't an object I wouldn't even be looking at a point and shoot so it seems kind of counter-intuitive to read a review website and have them tell you "Your best bet is to buy the $350 Sony"Picture Quality: It has alot of 'fuzz' in the pictures when you view them at full size. I thought this was because of point and shoots tenacity for raising the ISO to ridiculous levels but even with the ISO set to 200 or 400 manually it still has alot of fuzz. The tilt/shift "mini" mode is sort of fun, but takes a while to process and apply the effects and can be added to a greater degree in post processing (READ: Photoshop). Macro pictures seem to come out pretty decent and for some reason don't seem to have as much distortion/fuzz/blur. I haven't taken it underwater yet, it says it's for fresh or sea water only so I assume swimming pools being chlorinated are out (which is sort of the kicker unless you live by the beach). I'm not sure on salt water pools but I assume they should be ok.Video Quality: It's 720P it picks up motion ok and lower level light (not sure HOW low level but my test video came out very decent) is ok too. I filmed my wife and daughter rolling skater at sunset and the video was of acceptable quality.Summary: Over-all it's not stellar, but will suffice for our trip and will be a great camera (shock-proof waterproof) for my wife and daughter to use especially because even if she get's it grubby a quick rinse and it's good as new (I hope!). It's small will fit well in even a clutch purse or pocket, it's slim and lightweight. iA (Intelligent Autofocus) makes things EXTREMELY simple with facial recognition autofocus, auto flash, red-eye removal, and automatically detects when objects are close and switches to macro mode. This is awesome for my wife and daughter who don't even know what the term "macro mode" means.

Reviews.Title: Took the camera to the Bahamas and worked under water great!
Reviews.Author: melissa
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It worked really well.  Some hints, make sure that you follow the directions and soak it in tap water after the salt water, and then let it air dry before you open it... I think that's why others have had problems.  The other thing is, make sure you have it in the correct mode when taking pictures otherwise they won't look as crisp and wipe off the lens if you are going from pictures underwater to the beach or they might have water spots on them.  We have amazing pictures with this little camera!

Reviews.Title: Kayaking gave no problems
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I've used disposable water proof camera and did not like them.  So I decided to buy a waterproof digital camera instead.  I wanted it for the main purpose of being able to kayak and not have to worry about the camera.  I just came back from a trip.  I kept the camera in my bathing suit pocket when not taking pictures.  I took quite a few from the kayak and no issues with water.  I put the camera in my pocket but later had to jump into the water to help a kayaker who fell out of their kayak.  I actually forgot it was there.  I got back into my kayak after swimming around for a few minutes, took the camera out and continued to use it.  When I got back to the hotel, I followed instructions, soaking it in fresh water for 10 minutes, let it dry and then accessed the memory card.  I had absolutely no problems.The only issue I had (and I figured it out pretty early) is that the drops I saw through the view finder were actually on the lens window (I'm used to view finders not being the lens) so some of my shots had water drops in the way.  I started wiping the lens window (calling it a window because the lens itself is protected) before taking a picture.  Underwater this would not have been an issue, but I was on top.The pictures are pretty large (about 3.5 - 5mb) because it is 16mp.  I'm used to 12mp which gives about 2-2.5mb, so I bought a larger SD card.  The pictures were pretty good.  Not quite as good as my Panasonic Lumix ZS5, but much better than a throwaway.  The zoom is only good enough for framing a picture, but again, more zoom than the throwaways I've used.  Size-wise, it is a little thinner than the ZS5 and fits into a men's pants or shorts pocket (we all know women's pants and shorts can barely hold a credit card).  I would say (though I don't own one), same length and slightly thicker than an iPhone.If you're looking for a cheap (price) camera to supplement a regular camera when near or in the water, this does an excellent job.  Not sure if I would use it as my only camera, though you could.

Reviews.Title: Good balance for price
Reviews.Author: Duke Snider
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera to take snorkeling in USVI.  Because this camera would just be used for that I really didn't want to spend too much.  Considered camera bags/pouches and the 'one use' disposable cameras also.The good:It is definately waterproof.  4 days of dunking and not a single drop got in.  One day my family took it SNUBA diving to depth of 12 to 16 feet for 30 minutes and still not a drop.  I made sure to follow the sealing instructions.  We dropped it once in the ocean but the orange camera color made for easy rediscovery.  Nice wide lens for close shots.  The 4x optical zoom was not a limitation because underwater the clarity of the water falls off at any distance, so most shots were up close anyway.  In that case, wider is better.The bad:The coloring of some shots just wasn't quite right and sharpness was lacking at times.Conclusion:Highly recommend this camera for its intended use around and in water to a depth of 16 feet.  It won't replace a good camera for dry land but for its price you get alot of "toughness".

Reviews.Title: Adequate for what it is
Reviews.Author: Anthony Ruggeri "hard to pin down"
Reviews.Content: "Adequate for what it is" - well, what is it?  It's a very low cost, you might even say near-disposable, underwater camera.  Read through the reviews for any underwater camera and you will find complaints about water leakage, so none of these products are infallible.  My view is that it's better to have a lower-cost model with some compromises when none of the alternatives are going to have perfect water protection, image quality, or ergonomics, because if something goes wrong, you can just buy another one.I'm not a serious underwater photographer; if I were, I'd want an SLR with an expensive underwater housing.  What I did want was something that could take a bit of a beating and go underwater, and as a bonus even survive to be used again in a similar fashion.  This by itself is an improvement over any standard compact camera, which (and I know from experience) will die a quick and hopefully painless death after even one curious if accidental foray into the briny deep.The TS20 is very small, very light, and the actual water sealing looks very flimsy - but it works.  Just don't expect a solid "sealed vault" feel to the door -- it closes, that's all, and it does keep the water out.The lens is unremarkable (somewhat slow), the LCD is a bit laggy, and the image quality is about what you'd expect (ok in good light, lousy otherwise), but you'll get pictures that you wouldn't otherwise have.  The 16 megapixel resolution is just a marketing spec; from a quality standpoint, a 16 megapixel raw image from something like a Nikon D7000 is going to be on another planet compared to what comes out of the TS20.  But again -- that D7000 won't go underwater.In summary, it's good for what it does -- just understand what that is, and you'll be fine if it's sufficient to meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: Survived fall onto rocks and 2 days under water
Reviews.Author: Jamil
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 10 months ago and I use it when I'm fishing so I don't have to worry about dropping it in the sand or water. I've had no complaints so far, and the picture quality is very good, but up until a couple days ago it hasn't really seen any harsh use. But I just had an incredible experience so I just had to write a review.I was fishing from the rocky shore of a bay (it's like a bank of boulders going into the water) and set the camera down on some of the rocks. When I reached to pick it back up I clumsily knocked it off and watched and heard it tumble down between some of the rocks and into the water. At first I thought no big deal, after all that's why I use a waterproof camera (I hadn't even thought about the shockproofness), but I quickly found out it had fallen so far between the rocks that it was out of sight, and even worse out of reach. I spent probably 20 minutes with my shoes and pants soaked standing in the water reaching between the rocks and scratching up my hands but I couldn't find the camera. I was super bummed because I had just caught 2 types of fish that I'd never caught before and had those pictures on the camera, and also the SD card contained pictures of my pregnant wife's belly that we've been taking each week. So it was more about wanting the pictures back than the camera.I decided my best hope was to come back at low tide with a magnet on a string and see if I could see it and fish it out. Unfortunately that was on a Thursday evening and because of work the next low tide I had free was Saturday evening. After 2 days of dread I went back to the same spot where the camera fell (luckily I scratched the rocks with my pliers so I could find the same spot) and I was happy to see that the water level was significantly lower. In fact I was able to stand lower down on the rock bank and peek through a gap from the side and my heart lifted when I saw the camera sitting there. I was able to just reach in and grab it (I couldn't do that before because my head would have been under water). And the best part, I was amazed when i pushed the power button and the camera turned right on! I took some test pictures and everything was still working perfectly. What a relief.So in summary, after tumbling down rocks and spending 48 hours outdoors, half of that time under sea water, the camera survived. Later upon further inspection at home the only thing I noticed was a tiny bit of condensation in the lens and flash areas, but not in the screen. After a day of sitting out now the condensation is gone. So needless to say I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: patrick holian
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as replacement for Canon D10 which went around the world above and underwater, 1000's of pics and lots of abuse.Just wanted to try a less bulky camera, more mega pix.  My enthusiasm lasted a few weeks.  After using camera underwater the first time,battery and sd card were wet, camera went on/off by itself and then quit for good.  Comparing the two waterproof cameras and quality ofpictures, especially underwater, i will go back to the Canon D10 which will last longer than 60 minutes underwater.

Reviews.Title: Warning about underwater use!!!!
Reviews.Author: Keng
Reviews.Content: I purchased the TS20 from Amazon.com 2 days before my trip to Mexico.  Above water, the camera is everything expected (lightweight, stunning photos, easy navigation, slim profile, etc... If this was not advertised as a waterproof camera, I would have given it 4 stars... underwater is another story.  Before I get into what I happened, just know that I studied the user manual thoroughly before I used it in the water.The first day of the trip was completely away from the water.  Took some token pictures of mountains, the ocean, etc, etc; routine stuff.  The second day of my trip I went snorkeling and this is where the trouble began.  I took the camera snorkeling and captured some great pictures and video underwater.  Even in water the view finder provided clear images.  After about 30 minutes or so in the water, I swam back to the boat and began to clean the camera;  The manual provides basic cleaning instructions and I followed them to a tee.... about 45 minutes after I got onto the boat, I took the camera out to take some more pictures.  The camera came on, but all the buttons ceased to work.  I could not zoom in, use the menu or use any of the camera's functions after that.  I was relieved to find all my images/video were saved onto the SD card, but the camera was still inoperable, which is really a shame because the underwater shots came out great.Currently I am in the process of sending the camera back to Panasonic to see if they can do anything under the warranty... best case scenario they fix the camera and I use it only for above water photos... worst case scenario, I purchased a $135 paper weight...UPDATE 12/1/2012:I received a replacement camera late last week. In the notice included with the packaging, Panasonic stated the camera was either re-manufactured or brand new. From the looks of the packaging it appears to be a brand new camera.  Either way, the camera is in full working order and has been designated as my main "out of water" camera.  FYI... They also sent me an entire new set of cables, battery, charger, etc.. which was good because I left the original charger back in Mexico.About the process:I had to call and get a authorization code, send in the camera with a letter stating what happened and wait about 3-4 weeks.  Never received a call regarding the status, the replacement just showed up on my doorstep when I got home from work.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: TurkeyHunter
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long trip with my wife using this camera and loved it!  We spent a lot of time taking pictures underwater and they came out great.  The settings are easy to learn and to change back and forth between.  Here are the big pros in my book:-Easy point and shoot camera-Timer is very easy to use-Multi Shot (burst) function works great-Small camera so its easy to carry around I carried it in my swimsuit pocket-Takes great pictures-Easy to learnHere are the only realy cons I have found-Multi Shot (burst) does not allow flash-the lens can at times retain water on the outside causing water in the picture when you take it out of the waterI would purchase this again for sure.  I look forward to getting a lot of use from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect digicam for family on a budget.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Helmes
Reviews.Content: I almost let some negative reviews here and elsewhere steer me away from this little gem and couldn't be any happier that I did not. Kudos to Panasonic & Amazon for being the first to hit the $100 price point with a legitimate tough cam (apologies to those in market but missed that sweet Gold Box deal).News of the death of the pocket digicam have been greatly exaggerated. Otterbox or no, my precious iPhone 4S is going nowhere near open water. Neither is my Nikon D3100, purchased largely out of disgust with typically awful digicam shutter lag. But not only does the TS20 love the water, it's a pretty snappy performer too. Press the shutter button and it actually takes a picture in an instant--a novel concept STILL missed by many affordable cameras.I also love the dedicated record button that allows you to instantly shoot video without having to worry about the mode dial or god forbid, hunt through the menus like some cameras. Speaking of video, 30 minutes in high def is pretty impressive, especially at this price. While the zoom buttons take a little getting used to, you need to understand the usual spring-loaded thumb lever is not easily water-proofed. Engineering is a science of compromise, so concessions are to be expected on any budget model.I was afraid one such concession would be picture quality, especially while under water (isn't that really why we buy "tough" cams?) After seeing online comparisons of tough cams costing 3 & 4 times the price, I was absolutely stunned how good the TS20's underwater photos looked! Outdoor shots looked fantastic too. No doubt there are artifacts, fringing, and whatever not seen with a Canon EOS 5D Mark III, but seriously for $99, or even $138, you're simply not going to beat this bang for the buck any time soon.Almost on cue, on day one I accidentally knocked the camera off a towel rack (while changing out of my bathing suit after taking the aforementioned pictures.) I was concerned its light plastic body wouldn't truly be rugged like other metal bodied bricks I've tried, but it slammed onto the cherry hardwood floor without a scratch or dent...to the camera that is.By all means if you are going heliskiing at Mt. Kilimanjaro, step up to the TS4 or Olympus TG-1; however if you simply want to be able to take pictures at or in the backyard pool and local waterpark, you simply cannot go wrong with this camera. To me part of the beauty is that, at least for my budget, it is one thing to break or lose a $100 toy, and an entirely other thing if replacement will set me back $300 or $400. We buy a tough cam so we can go hard with it and take it anywhere without fear. Like a '97 Crown Vic (i.e. cheap car with an engine that won't quit), this camera is the ultimate beater.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Chalker
Reviews.Content: Needed a waterproof camera for a cruise, so I shopped around, compared prices and reviews, and settled on this one.  Was very happy with the results, particularly for the price point.  Was able to take lots of pictures at the beach, while snorkeling, and while swimming with dolphins.  The orange color wasn't so bright to be obnoxious, but distinct enough to make it stand out and easy to see.  Even the underwater videos came out great.  Be sure to watch the lens for water droplets... a couple pictures were ruined because we didn't wipe it off enough when splashing around in the water.

Reviews.Title: Great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Palmnut
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just over a month ago and it takes great pictures.  No blur when taking action pictures and also the quality/clarity of the underwater pictures is great.  Problem is, I've only had the camera for a month and it already isn't working.  When I turn it on I get a "focus error" on the screen and can do nothing with it.  Was a great camera while it lasted...

Reviews.Title: NOt "TOUGH" OR "WATERPROOF"
Reviews.Author: G. A. P. "G.A.P."
Reviews.Content: This camera is offered at a very competitive price which enticed me to buy it for a recent trip. Now all I can think of is the old maxim "You Get What You Pay For." In this case, I got a poor quality camera that even the manufacturer seems to acknowledge. Here are my quarrels with this camera and why you may want to look elsewhere in spite of the low price:1. POOR PICTURE QUALITY - Maybe it's the lens or the quality of the electronics, but the pictures I did manage to take with this camera were washed out and otherwise of poor quality (particularly in bright light situations). My camera phone did a better job in bright light situations.2. CONDENSATION ISSUES - I should have known something was up when Panasonic went so far as to put a special insert in the box about condensation issues and problems with the lens clouding over. Although Panasonic provides "tips" for avoiding this problem, my conclusion is that the design of this camera makes such issues unavoidable. After only a few weeks, and even following all the tips, the lens on this camera clouded over from condensation. The lens is now permanently cloudy and there is nothing you can do about it. The camera is rendered useless. I've used a lot of cameras in a lot of environments. This one is just not designed to take it. I am going to send this camera in for warranty service and I will post an addendum to let you know how it turns out. I'm not holding my breath that Panasonic will cover this problem.3. WATERPROOF SEALS ARE POOR QUALITY AND MUST BE REPLACED "AT EXTRA COST" YEARLY - That's right folks. Read the fine print. The requirements for keeping this camera waterproof read like a novel. Even if you do everything right, Panasonic says the flimsy waterproof seals need to be replaced every year at your cost. They surely don't tell you this up front. Can you imagine having to bring this $140 camera to an authorized repair facility every year and being charged for replacing the seals? Nobody is going to do that and Panasonic knows it. It's basically a disposable camera if you bring it in the water to begin with. After one year Panasonic admits it. Mine didn't make it past two months.I love praising a good product at a good price. This camera is not such a product. In my humble opinion, you would be better off spending a little more and getting a better waterproof camera that is truly as rugged as they claim.ADDENDUM: OF COURSE PANASONIC BLAMED ME FOR THE CAMERA HAVING CONDENSATION DAMAGE AND REFUSED TO HONOR THE WARRANTY. CLAIMS THERE IS CORROSION BUT THEY HAVE NO PHOTOS SHOWING IT. WITH A STRAIGHT FACE THEY OFFERED TO FIX A $139 CAMERA (PRICE I PAID)FOR $189 AND ASKED ME HOW I WOULD LIKE TO PAY FOR THE REPAIR. WOW - YOU WOULD HAVE TO BE A KNUCKLEHEAD TO EVER AGAIN DEAL WITH PANASONIC AND THEIR PRODUCTS.

Reviews.Title: Took great pictures for 5 minutes
Reviews.Author: David M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a cruise we were taking and wanted some underwater shots while snorkeling.  The camera took great pictures but after 5 minutes it began to get water into the LCD screen. Slowly we could see water move across the LCD and destroy it.  After 10 minutes the camera did not work at all...I guees the good thing was the battery and SIM card stayed dry.  Thank you Amazon for having an amazing return policy so I dont get stuck with this.

Reviews.Title: Very Slow
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: So far it seems sturdy and it is nice and compact, but it takes a long time between pictures.  Once you take a picture, it won't be ready to take another for about a full five seconds.  That seems like a pretty long time.

Reviews.Title: Great for water resistant
Reviews.Author: pt
Reviews.Content: Rain, Pool, Ocean! It works great. Image quality is decent. Quality settings are too easy to change without knowing. Exposure and metering could be a little better. Overall great for what it is.

Reviews.Title: Almost 100% happy......
Reviews.Author: Kevin Johnson "Kevin on-the-go"
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the camera's abilities, functions, pictures, and videos.  Too bad the software that comes with the camera isn't Mac compatible (no Mac downloads for this photo suite on panasonic's website either). I know there is free software out there, I just think that the software is part of the purchase price and should work with both PC/Mac. Panasonic needs to catch up with the rest of the software world.

Reviews.Title: Great water camera, good out-of-water one, good-enough videos
Reviews.Author: krzysztof wozniak
Reviews.Content: The camera is great in water, taking sharp, colorful pictures. It's also good out-of-water, though like many small cameras it over-saturates the colors and sometimes it's hard to make it focus where you want it to. Also, the zoom is a bit slow for my taste.The videos are good enough for the web, and the stabilization works surprisingly well, eliminating shake. Don't think it'll replace a camcorder for your family videos, though - it's not that kind of camera.Overall I love it - it's small, light, looks great, takes good-quality pictures and videos - what's not to like?

Reviews.Title: Faulty - Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: botw
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera, which I picked up for a beach, pool, kids type point and shoot.  Unfortunately, the image quality was mediocre at best, with soft images, lots of flare, poor color rendition, and little ability to control camera settings.  My copy also had some crazy lines going through the video.  Obviously, I may have had a faulty unit (I returned it), but you should not buy this expecting it to produce images as nice as a typical point and shoot.  It doesn't.By way of comparison, I have a Canon SX260, a Sony NEX5n, and some higher end Canon dslrs.  It's only moderately fair to compare to the SX260, which is also a small sensor point and shoot.  The Canon kills it in exposure, colors, sharpness and controls.  Obviously, it's not waterproof though.In sum, if you do get this, temper your expectations and realize you will be sacraficing some image quality for the "rugged" features.  In that category, it's a relative bargain, but only if you aren't expecting to make large prints and have realistic expectations about the IQ it will produce.

Reviews.Title: failed in 13 months...1 month out of warranty
Reviews.Author: Bobby Oberlechner
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews.  I probably should because I purchase a lot of products and for the most part, they perform as advertised. However, I purchased this camera in late August of 2012 to take on a cruise.  We used it and enjoyed it for the 2 days that we were doing underwater pictures. We used it a time or two above water during the next 12 months.  We took less than 100 pictures and less than 5 minutes of video all total in a year. This year we packed it again to take on another cruise. mind you, an additional month has passed and we are in our 13th month of ownership.  On the second day, the camera fails, the screen goes white, and we have access to nothing. So when we get back, we send it in for repair. Panasonic is telling us that it is out of warranty. OK..well if it is out of warranty, then I guess Fuji gets my business from now on. At least they stand behind their products. Do not buy this or you will be wasting your money....yes I am upset enough to write a review...that's how bad it is.Update 10-10-13. I called 3 different numbers and emailed the main office after I sent my camera to the repair facility in McAllen Texas. All said the same thing;"if it is out of warranty there is nothing we can do". So I waited....I finally received an email that asked me to send it to the repair facility and NOT include all of my accessories as they have them there...so I at least got the answer to that mystery. Well today when I came home, I had received a box from the repair facility. In it was a replacement (the next newer model) camera. I am excited that they replaced it and I do not have to buy another so to be fair to them, kudos to the repair facility in McAllen, Texas.  Panasonic needs a better repair, info, warranty center.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Del G "delg23"
Reviews.Content: So amazing it works under water. Extremely durable. It has survived 2 years with two toddlers!!! The pictures may not be as good as some other cameras but its a pretty  good camera in that department too.

Reviews.Title: OK, but not great.
Reviews.Author: Hal R. Mcwilliams
Reviews.Content: It works well overall but has a problem in flash conditions and sunlight. If facing the sun I have to shield the lense cover (fixed) with my hand, otherwise you get bad artifacts. In flash pictures I get a lot of snow and artifacts. I guess this all has to do with it being waterproof so it has a solid glass lens cover which gives optical problems.EDIT 8/1/2013. Recently got a chance to try it out underwater, worked fine, no leaks. Had it to about 3 foot depth in fresh water, took video and still images and worked well.EDIT 12/16/2013. Leaked pool water, still turns on but images fogged, trying to dry it out but prognosis is not good.

Reviews.Title: stops working within weeks! DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Romeo Edward Enriquez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my father-in-law who lives in a different state. Within a few weeks he called to tell me the screen went dark and would not show images. Figuring he had changed a setting or pushed a button, I told him I would look at it next time I came to visit. Sure enough, it wasn't him and the camera had a defect. After searching the issue online I found numerous other people who experienced the same thing. Do not buy this camera unless you like to waste your money!!

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Robert D.
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive camera to replace my parents old 3 MP. They're fairly clumsy with their stuff, and after having this camera for 6 months it's safe to say that I'm glad I chose this one. It goes on sale occasionally, and at the discounted rate ($129 or lower) it's totally worth it.This camera has survived minor water, drops, crushes, candle wax (don't ask...) and still shoots great pictures. Of course, it has it's drawbacks but for my parents that need an easy to use camera that just works and won't break on them when they knock it off of the table, we've found a perfect match. We have taken it under water in short bursts (not submerging it for a long time) and have not had any problems with leaking.Pros:-Durable-Great image colour, good contrast-Useful zoom range-Good button layout-PriceMiddle:-High ISO is not bad for a point-and-shoot, but not fantastic either-I've never been a fan of panisonic's menu set-up, but the parents seem to understand it easy enough-Flash performance is moderate, but better than most I've triedDrawbacks:-Even ISO 100 shots tend to be a bit noisy at 100%: if you're intending to make giant prints (12 x 18" +) I'd suggest avoiding this camera, but for anything less than that ie 4x6 or 5x7 or 8x10, or for web use, the photos look great. Also, the noise doesn't get noticeably worse until over ISO 400.For my parents, who don't need anything too fancy, just something that will last, this has been a good purchase and has continued to deliver solid image quality and performance in a budget package. If you can catch it on sale, I wouldn't hesitate to pick one up.4.3/5

Reviews.Title: Perfect for vacation!
Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pictures under and above water. Not as nice as my primary compact digital camera, but it certainly exceeded my expectations! It survived the sand, swimming in the ocean, and tons of great snorkeling pictures came from it too. Great investment and I'm very happy with my purchase! Would recommend! :)

Reviews.Title: Worked Great for our trip...then 3 days later won't turn on
Reviews.Author: Cat Woman
Reviews.Content: The camera worked awesome for our cruise.  We got great video as well as snorkeling pics.  I rinsed it with fresh water after the snorkeling.  It took awesome pictures and never gave me any trouble.  Battery held for a long time as well.  3 days after vacation, I took the camera out to take a picture at home and it wouldn't turn on.  I charged up the battery just in case it can inadvertently run down. Put it back in, still nothing.I'm sad because it was a great camera.  Maybe I got a lemon battery or something.  They have to give me a refund because the one I ordered is not available to give me an exchange. :(

Reviews.Title: Used it once
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I used this camera once and had to return it.  I took it into the water on vacation, then took it back to the hotel and soaked it in fresh water and let dry for 24 hours.  When I tried to use it the next day everything was foggy.  I wasn't expecting professional pictures but I expected it to work more than once.

Reviews.Title: Broke in 30 minutes
Reviews.Author: Jake Philips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this camera recently to use while snorkeling in the Virgin Islands over Xmas and New Years.  I did all the recommended pre-tests before use and followed the directions for underwater use exactly as laid out in the instructions.  Everything started out fine on our first snorkel, but after 30 to 35 minutes, the screen when black and the camera quit working.  At first we hoped that maybe the battery was just dead, but when we got back to the place we were staying, the charger acted as if the battery was fully charged.  After trying every option we could think of, we were forced to admit that the camera was just broken.  With no ability to easily replace it during our trip we missed out on being able to photograph 9 more days of amazing snorkeling.  I absolutely do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof. Water in battery compartment and under screen after one day...
Reviews.Author: idontlikepennames
Reviews.Content: This camera started out great and took some decent above-water pictures. But after one day of underwater use, water seeped past the seal and into the battery/SD compartment. This messed up the internals and meant the SD card reader no longer worked. Also, water somehow got under the LCD screen and that part stopped working too.All this happened after ONE HOUR of normal use, in 1 ft-deep saltwater. I followed every single cleaning and drying instruction from the manual.Thankfully was able to return it for my money back. Will NOT be buying a Panasonic camera again.

Reviews.Title: Bomb
Reviews.Author: Rhianna Ulrich
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas and used it to take holiday photos of the vacation we were on.  They are all ruined and I am very upset.  White spots are all over the photos.  Originally, I assumed they were just dist, so I cleaned the lens. When that didn't work, I assumed they were reflection/glare spots, but they were on EVERY photo no matter where I was (inside or outside) and if the flash was utilized or not.  The spots were never in the same location, even if I was using a tripod and took photos, in succession, of the same scene with the same lighting. After having other people, including a professional photographer, look over the camera to try and figure out the issue and how to fix it, we were all left confused as to why it has an issue.  Needless to say I am very disappointed and am returning the camera.  Our past point and shoot, also a waterproof/shockproof camera, was an Olympus and I will be going back to that brand.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY for an underwater camera...NEVER BEEN MORE DISAPPOINTED with a purchase from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Dan Sincavage
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera as a gift for my girlfriend so that we could have a nice camera for our trip to Mexico. At 16.1 MP, it seemed like a great small camera that would work for underwater pictures as well as pictures elsewhere out of the water. The camera comes up with a warning outlining the necessary precautions for underwater use. I had read all the prior reviews and assumed that those who were frustrated with their purchase must have neglected to follow these simple precautions. I was very wrong in this assumption!Within no more than 15 minutes of use, following all the on-camera precautions, the camera no longer worked. I could potentially have understood this if we were diving deep down in the ocean and putting a significant amount of pressure on the camera, but we never had it deeper than 3 feet in our hotel pool. After being turned off, the camera came back on but the buttons no longer worked. Then, the buttons began to work again, but moisture had already made its way into the camera and it was impossible to capture a photo and have any recognition of what the camera had taken a picture of.The description of this camera states that it is "tough," but I can honestly assure you that is not the case. We have had other underwater cameras in the past, including a fujifilm underwater camera that lasted us nearly three years of great pictures under much more strenuous conditions than this camera. I will be returning this camera to Amazon and expecting a full refund as well as something to mitigate the fact that we were left with no camera in Mexico for a good portion of our trip.I know it seems easy to assume that myself and the other reviewers who had similar issues simply did not follow the precautions, but that is what I thought as well and here I am writing a similar review. If you want to get an underwater camera, I would highly advise you to look elsewhere for your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working completely after one time underwater!
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: ---Update 1/18/2013---I sent the broken TS20 camera to Panasonic a few weeks back after speaking to a customer service agent and following her instructions (e.g. send all components, case #, and a description of the problem). Today I received from Panasonic a replacement for the TS20 - a refurbished TS4. I haven't used the new camera yet, but from a quick Amazon search it seems a [new] TS4 costs about twice as much as a TS20 and has more features than the TS20, albeit only 12MP vs. 16MP.While Panasonic did send me a replacement camera, I can't in good conscious change the rating for the original TS20.  The fact is that the TS20 broke after only one underwater use, which is unacceptable.  However, my opinion of Panasonic and their customer service is improved after receiving a replacement camera.---Original review---Executive Summary: I do not recommend this camera to anyone attempting to use it underwater since it died on me after one use.I bought this camera ~2 weeks ago specifically for my trip to the Great Barrier Reef to take pictures underwater while snorkeling.  I also used it as my point-and-shoot camera while in Australia when it was easier/faster then using our DSLR.  Prior to being submerged in water the camera took great pictures and I was happy with it.  It focused quickly in full auto mode, and even adjusted automatically for shots of landscapes vs. plants/flowers vs. portrait.The first time I went snorkeling the camera took OK shots.  It still focused on what I wanted and the 4x optical zoom was handy since at points where we were the GBR is 10-40ft below the surface and the fish aren't always accommodating to portraits.  On review, most of the pictures turned out to be a little on the green side.  I suppose this is to be expected with underwater shots.After snorkeling the first time, I followed the instructions and rinsed the camera off with fresh water and let it sit for a little while (~1hr).  When I looked at it again, both the lens and the LCD screen were foggy, meaning any shot I took was blurred so as to be useless.  I let it sit for another ~1hr and tried again for my last snorkel of the day.  Both lens and LCD were still foggy and I was not able to take any more decent pictures.  The foggyness never did go away.When I returned to the hotel to view some shots, the camera turned on with a completely white LCD screen, followed by a couple beeps, followed by some error messages ('error: zoom'  what?).  At this point, the camera is useless. Now that I am home, the camera won't even turn on at all.  No LCD screen response, no pictures, nothing. It makes a noise like a Geiger counter sometimes, but otherwise is completely dead.Very, very unsatisfied with this purchase and am unlikely to buy a camera from Panasonic again, especially not an "underwater" camera. Do not recommend to anyone who wants to use the camera underwater.  Above ground it took nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: highly recommend
Reviews.Author: loyalkindlefan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my husband & I were going on a week-long cruise where we would be doing several water & beach excursions. I was unsure if it would actually work under water & what the quality of the photos would be so I took my regular camera in case this one stopped working. I was very pleasantly surprised. I took this camera in the ocean while snorkeling and was able to get clear awesome pictures of some pretty translucent looking fish as well as a see-through jelly-fish with a slight purple coloring at the edges! I was so excited and many people on the water excursions would stop and ask me about the camera (i.e. price, where I got it and if it took good pics) everyone I showed it to stated that they were definitely getting one for their next trip. This is one of the best buys ever. I put the camera in "sport mode" while zip-lining and snapped away. Not one picture blurred. Every one was clear and I never once worried about losing the camera because I just strapped & adjusted it to my wrist while in the water & flying through the air. My only regret is that I didn't buy this sooner for other trips we've taken.

Reviews.Title: Camera leaked after 1st use :(
Reviews.Author: david boehme
Reviews.Content: I like the concept of waterproof cameras but wish the TS20 had better execution.  The camera looks nice and took good out of the water.  In the water with the flash it tended to wash out the pic or get glare off the sea plankton.  The real issue was after the maiden snorkeling voyage the camera leaked.  Initially it was a small amount into the battery compartment and eventually would reach the battery terminal and short out the camera.  So I took it back to the room to cleaned it up (Since we were in salt water I followed the directions for a 10 minute soak in fresh water to clean the camera).  Then completely drying everything overnight.  On the second trip the LCD in back had a flog in it which made picture viewing difficult. Still some pics seemed to turn out OK. But the camera lens must have had some water because every few pics they would be randomly blurred.I'm not sure if it was a defective product or just the model since I did follow the directions.  Either way I went with a more expensive Fuji XP100 and will be trying that out this week.

Reviews.Title: Water-logged on first use
Reviews.Author: NYer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for an upcoming cruise as it is waterproof to 15 feet.  I've used it on land to get used to its features and it is really simple. BUT -- WATER-LOGGED ON FIRST USE!!  I locked the door but water must have entered as it died almost immediately! Luckily SD card had 10 photos and they are fine but this is NOT a good or reliable camera for snorkeling.  Even though it is past the return date, I am sending it back out of frustration and anger.  Get something else!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Dan Hach "Dan"
Reviews.Content: Had to return it because the picture quality was unacceptable. I did try al the possible setup and did not get any good pics.  Is good for a child not for a family vacation. I already bought another one, of course more expensive but worth the money. Thank you amazon for the return policies!

Reviews.Title: Hawaii Vacation!!
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I took this camera to Hawaii. We loved it. Other reviews said it leaked so that had us a bit concerned but we found that with the correct care (Soaking in clean water for 10 minutes after use) this camera was the PERFECT choice for us :) We had our good Cannon camera for everyday dry pictures and this one for our possible water shots. It was so light weight and small carrying 2 cameras worked for us!
