I took some really awesome underwater pictures of fish and corral while snorkeling on several occasions as well as pictures from when we swam out to a waterfall.I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Gift for kid, good rough/safe camera for all ages!
Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: Does NOT come with memory card.I was not impressed by bulk etc. but it seems great so far! Everything 'mechanical' has a snug secure fit and the software is 'standard'.Have not tried it under water but basic setup and first few photos have worked out great used as a 'regular' camera.We got it for a seven year old and she loves it, and to be honest I would get one for myself if I needed one! Seems like a great camera! (Will come back and add if it proves to not be the case!)

Reviews.Title: Really wish this had held up...
Reviews.Author: R. Miller
Reviews.Content: Took this as our "action" camera on a recent cruise down to the Caribbean.  Spent a day out and about, including taking it into some light surf and it worked fine.  Picture quality was not up to the standard of our other cameras, but not bad.  When we got back to our cabin I dutifully soaked in fresh water for about 20 minutes and then let air dry for another few hours.  Recharged the battery and verified the seal was clear and clean, before preparing it for the next day.The second day was a long boat trip snorkeling and was able to get some pretty decent shots.  I left the camera on the entire time I was in the water and took quite a few shots of turtles, fish, etc.  When I got back on the boat, one of the crew members poured some fresh water on the camera saying that the salt water can really have an effect on the these, for which I was grateful.  Unfortunately, when I went to turn the camera back on for the next leg of the trip, it was completely dead.  I assumed that the battery had just expired, but was a bit upset that now I had no camera for the rest of this "once and a lifetime" snorkle...Got back to the cabin and reran the same precautions, soaked camera for 20 minutes, shook out water, let dry for a few hours.  That night when I went to pull the battery to recharge I noticed moisture on both the battery and the memory card ... the camera was TOAST!!!  Luckily the rest of the trip we had our "good" camera, but would have liked to take more pictures on beach, water, etc.I give Amazon 5 stars for allowing me to return with a refund, but I give this camera 0 stars for dependability.  Hence the 2 star review.I'm going on another water based trip in April; I'll buy something just before I go and hope it lasts longer than one swim.  I'll also remember to ALWAYS bring a backup!

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive and ok for snapshots
Reviews.Author: GD
Reviews.Content: Used once and held up waterproof after brief submersion in a river.  Photos outdoor are acceptable for snapshots.  All images are pixelated/noisy.  Indoor flash shots are not good (overexposed, reflections). Pros include price, quick shutter and small size. As long as it stays waterproof, I won't complain.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Billy Ray
Reviews.Content: This camera has been more than I ever expected. I have had and used this Lumix for almost two months now. I first tested it in a swimming pool down to 20' and had no issues. I then took it knee boarding and again no issues. I just returned from a one week snorkeling vacation in Cozumel and I have to say that I love this camera! My friends are all wanting one as well, we were in a group of ten. Some of them have Canon cameras, one being waterproof, and were also impressed with the quality of pictures and especially video. I also ordered the yellow float strap and additional memory card. I took well over 500 pictures and at least 60 videos over the course of two months and I have recharged the battery three times. Also the memory card still has plenty of room on it. I never rinsed the camera off after use like I was supposed to but I will from now on just to be safe. I highly recommend this little camera! It has a pretty decent zoom as well, even during video. I never took it off of underwater mode and the pics on land still came out great. It has a sleek design, great color, etc. I also love how easy it is to switch from pictures to video and back. Playback is simple as well as turning on or off the flash etc. I was doing these things under water while snorkeling. IT turns on fast too so it's easy to catch a quick pic. I have yet to read the owners manual so there isn't much of a learning curve on how to operate it. I cannot say enough about this little guy, buy it!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my honeymoon to the Caribbean and was very happy with it.  We went snorkeling the entire week we were there and took the camera out every time.  The pictures came out very clear and the camera was fairly easy to operate.  I kept it turned on almost constantly when we were in the water so I could snap quick shots of fish.  It had to be recharged twice in the entire week, but we were using it a lot.  Occasionally there would be a water spot on the lens that would create a blurry spot in pictures, but this was easily fixed by wiping the water drop away.  We made sure to soak it every day in fresh water and opened it up 2-3 times to make sure we were cleaning out any loose pieces of sand.  This was a great investment for what we needed and I was very pleasantly surprised at the picture quality.  I've already recommended it to friends who are looking for underwater cameras!

Reviews.Title: Never turned on
Reviews.Author: Cyd
Reviews.Content: Received the package quickly and well packaged; Amazon ROCKS! Opened it up, charged the battery, read the directions, put the battery in, and tried to turn it on. Error. Wouldn't even turn on. Looked in the user manual to see if there was anything about this error. Nothing. Checked with customer service and it would need shipped in for service... before it was ever used. I sent it back to amazon and got an Olympus, which was the only thing available locally and we needed our camera right away by this point, and loved it!

Reviews.Title: Had to Return unit for replacement
Reviews.Author: TKEL757
Reviews.Content: I will wait to see how the replacement unit operates. the camera started acting strange and the viewing screen would flash on and off rapidly so you could not see what you were trying to photograph nor review the phos takes. Occasionally it would work correctly then start flashing again?????

Reviews.Title: Leaked and failed
Reviews.Author: C0oP3r
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically for the cruise I just got back on. Worked fine on land, takes good pictures in bright light or with flash. Made sure battery door was perfectly clean and took it out snorkeling in St. Thomas and never took it deeper then 8ft and didn't have it in the water for longer then 30 minutes as I took breaks to go see my GF on shore. Average depth was 1ft as it just dangled to my arm. Lens started fogging up, Opened battery door, a few drops of water inside. Let it dry out but auto focus quit working. Will return with Amazon. Half my trip didn't get documented, thanks Panasonic. I'm really sad over the missed memories that we didn't get pictures of.

Reviews.Title: Leaking!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in my hotel in bora bora as I write this. I bought this camera for underwater shots during our honeymoon. By the third time I went underwater, the camera was leaking and getting error messages. I assume I've lost all pics. What a disappointment. The camera is poorly designed and looking at the cheap 'waterproof' panel, Im not surprised it leaked.Do Not Buy!

Reviews.Title: not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace another waterproof camera that I had lost. We needed a waterproof camera for snorkeling in Bermuda. I followed all of the directions, and the camera never went below five feet deep. Nevertheless, water got in and corroded the battery and destroyed the camera. On the first day of our vacation. Thankfully, the memory card was ok, so we had some pictures.The worst part? We got back from vacation the day after I could return it. I had not used it for more than 30 pictures, and now cannot even return it. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Numbersman
Reviews.Content: Had the camera for two weeks and contacted the tech support several times.  Tried every setting possible but couldn't get a good photograph.  The photos were all washed out, bright and nowhere near true color.  My 5 year old Kodak with 8.1 MP was far superior.  I've returned the camera and purchased a Canon camera which I expect to receive soon.  The Canon will have less feature like no rechargable battery but should give me better quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable focus
Reviews.Author: gadgetcollector "mimi"
Reviews.Content: Pro: nice size, good display screen, sturdy feelCon: rarely took a sharp picture, refused to focus at timesFirst the good part. I took a lot of pictures with this camera on vacation. It slid into a pocket easily, had a bright screen, and didn't attract attention so I got a lot of candid shots. The zoom works while filming movies. And the panorama function was cool.The bad: It focuses slowly and poorly and not at all at times. The problem was so I had to reset it by powering it off once in a while. At the end of the day I reviewed my pictures and deleted fuzzy ones I didn't catch at the time. Worst of all many I did keep had to be tweeked with editing software and still look bad in a slideshow.Did not use it underwater. Oh, and for a "beach" camera it was totally overwhelmed by glare even on its special setting.I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend
Reviews.Author: Tony Rivera
Reviews.Content: Not to thrilled about the camera. We bought it to take down to Pensacola with us. We only got to use it once before it started leaking. Now we're having problems with Samy's Camera who wont take it back, and also am having problems with Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for a little buck!
Reviews.Author: MBlackwell
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer with a substantial amount of money invested in to my cameras.  My wife and I planned a second trip to Bermuda and I wanted to pick up an affordable point and shoot that was waterproof.  After researching for several months I had decided on this camera and I'm very happy I did.  Buying this camera primarily for water use like snorkeling or taking to the beach, I couldn't have asked for a better inexpensive camera.  It performed flawlessly.  Prior to taking it to Bermuda I test drove the camera in an area river used for recreation.  Not a single problem and it shot great video.  Following the instructions for water use to a T, I had not one issue.  In Bermuda I used the camera for a solid hour while snorkeling taking both photographs and shooting video in the water.  No problem with battery life or water leakage.  I give this camera 2 thumbs up and would recommend it to anyone looking for a cheaper alternative to the more expensive water cameras.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE
Reviews.Author: PO'ed
Reviews.Content: Camera was defective out of the box.  The battery was charged as instructed in the manual.  Not sure if supplied battery was bricked somehow or if the camera itself was defective.  Good luck troubleshooting with Panasonic's esthemed call center...

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater. Poor in high and low light.
Reviews.Author: Big Chris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use on a trip to Puerto Rico because I planned on kayaking and hanging out at the beach... both of which would be a death sentence for a regular camera. In that sense, this camera performed amazingly well. It is compact and the waterproofing works perfectly. The lens has a tendency to collect water on a little ledge at the bottom and it will show up on pictures, but running your finger over the lense remedies that problem easily. Underwater pictures turn out surprisingly clear and normal everyday photos turn out well.Unfortunately, this camera has issues with high and low light conditions. Low light pictures look almost like they were taking with a cell phone... pretty grainy and lacking contrast. Bright light, such as the sun behind your subject, will cause your pictures to be pretty washed out. Otherwise, if you're not in either of those two extremes, the pictures turn out perfectly fine... similar to any other mid-range digital camera.I also liked how sturdily built it is. The camera was banging around on the kayak and I knocked it against a million other things but it kept on going.For what it is--a waterproof camera--the quality and price can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: It broke!  Purchased it in May 2012 (3 months).
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: For an underwater camera, it takes very good pictures and very good videos.  I really liked this camera but it did have some focus issues with video from about 2-3 feet, but other than that I was having fun with this camera and I was happy with my purchase.I bought the TS20 for vacation and wanted some time to test it out, now a little more than two weeks before vacation, it got the "system error (focus) which seems to be a common problem.  There was nothing I could do to rectify the issue (removed battery & charged it, removed SD card).  I called Panasonic and they said I had to return it.  I hate to think it but it probably will never make it back in time for vacation.  A few days before the vacation if it's not here, I'll buy another one but this time it probably will not be a Panasonic, time will tell.I'll be back to update my misfortune!!Stars will be edited upon repair.Update:Well, what can I say?  Panasonic has had the camera for over a week and their system keeps telling me that "still can't find your service request".  I had to call and jump through hoops to get someone that could find something out about my return for repair.  People telling me it's getting ready to be shipped, it's going out today and we will email you with the tracking number....I'm still waiting with no email.Due to my not feeling very "warm & fuzzy" with Panasonic, I now have spent another over $250 for the Olympus TG-810, thanks Pany!Update:Here it is, Friday, 8 days after Panasonic received the camera and still no email and I still can't find any information about the repair on the Panasonic support website.SUPRISE!  on my front porch, there was a package!  A refurbished camera!  I have used it for the last two days and it's still working!  Eleven days total (including weekend) from my shipping time to them to my front door, very fast turnaround!Thank you Panasonic but if you had your website running properly so it would update the status, I would not have had to purchase another camera!  Oh well let's see how it goes and I guess the good thing is that I have a backup!Thanks again Panasonic, I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Really Nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Ferraro
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to the lake and I'm thrilled I did. The camera performed very well. I've owned it about a month and have used it on the lake vacation and a couple of other times when rain was in the forecast. The camera takes great shots of up to about 20-30 feet. It takes great group photos due to the wide angle LUMIX lens. It lacks a great optical zoom for far-away things, but what do you want for this price? It has some very cool features including a panorama feature that allows you to take awesome panorama shots with ease. Panorama pictures look great as two-page spreads in photo books or on large, flat screen TV's or computer screens. The photo quality is fantastic at 16.1MP. A MUST HAVE is some type of float that will prevent your camera from sinking to the bottom of the lake/pond/ocean. I bought this CHUMS float from Amazon as well. Chums Waterproof Camera Float The float detaches for when you don't need it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!!!
Reviews.Author: Shopper1911
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera at the beach several times.  Takes great shots for the camera price.  Best thing is that the battery holds a charge for at least a week with moderate use.  Replaced my older "thow in the purse" digital for this one, because the older one's battery was always dead when I wanted to take a picture.  Recommend for a camera to carry with you that you can use on the beach or in inclement weather.  Obviously not the same quality as a digital SLR, but I get tired of dragging a big camera around.  Have not tried underwater pictures and don't intend to.  This suits my needs exactly!

Reviews.Title: Buy it because it's sturdy and you won't be disappointed.
Reviews.Author: John White "Jwhite2"
Reviews.Content: All you need to know about this camera: it's sturdy.  If you want high quality photos then your in the wrong place.  Don't get me wrong, it will shoot decent stuff for everyday situations.  It even takes fairly nice quality underwater shots.The reason you want this camera is because it won't break, no matter where you are.  I am a youth pastor for a church and I bought this to take on our trips out of town.  We go to some rugged places and teens are not especially careful with electronics (or anything for that matter.)  I feel good about handing this off to the kids and letting them pass it around to take pictures of the event.  This means: 1) I don't have to worry about taking the pictures myself, 2) I don't have to worry about the camera breaking, not matter where we are.If you have kids or have a history of breaking cameras, this is the bet for you.  They make a nicer one for a little bit more money.  I can't comment on it's quality but I would imagine it's better.  For $120 this is a steal!  Buy it now and don't expect much out of the pictures and you will be happy.  If you want DSLR level shots then ... get a DSLR!

Reviews.Title: not so tough
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: prosgreat quality pictures for price. looks and functions great. water proof.consnot as tough as claimed, a simple drop cracked the screen quickly. should not be marketed as a tough camera as it only maintains normal impact resistance.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: R Nelson
Reviews.Content: First time out it leaked.  It was never submerged only splashed while sitting in my life jacket pocket.  Other people had their cameras in the water and they still work.  Stop making things in China.  I would pay 3 times the price for something that works and lasts.

Reviews.Title: Underwater & Wet Weather capability is nice, but photos are mediocre
Reviews.Author: Joshua A. Kirby
Reviews.Content: Sure, you can tote this anywhere. You might want a float strap, or a tether to ensure that it doesn't fall to the bottom of someplace you can't get to. But the photo quality is mediocre, especially for out-of-water shots. I use this as "my" camera, and my wife keeps the nicer point-and-shoot with her.

Reviews.Title: Works ok in water, horrible picture quality, terrible in anything other than very bright light
Reviews.Author: apabbott
Reviews.Content: The underwater feature has worked ok for us, although I see dozens of complaints from other reviewers about that issue.  My bone to pick with this camera is the terrible, almost unusable picture quality.  I understand that this is not a $1600 camera, but with today's advances in digital cameras, you think you could at least get picture quality that is as good, if not better, than a $30 cell phone or a disposable film camera.  All images have a soft quality with terrible noise. There is also a slight cool tint to all photos.  Most of them are unusable as prints.  I liked the idea of having a "tough" go anywhere camera, but I have found that you shouldn't waste money on features that you aren't likely to use.  My daughter took this to the pool a few times and got some neat shots, but that is the camera's limitations.  Great for water if you have to have that function, but almost useless as a device to capture decent photos for printing.  This camera sits in a junk drawer of our house, and we spent a little more money on a decent digital camera that takes worthy pics.

Reviews.Title: Third time's the charm!
Reviews.Author: Steven Traube "toys for sons"
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure:  I am a klutz.  I put my phone in my lap and then stand up and drop it.  I put money in my pocket then send it out to the dry cleaners.  I throw salt into recipes instead of sugar (well, no, I've never done that, but you get the idea).My first digital camera fell.  The battery holder cracked and it needed tape to keep it all closed and working.My second digital camera fell into water and, despite my desperately plunging it into a 10 pound bag of rice, broke.I wasn't taking any chances this time around.I bought an orange camera.  Why orange?  So that I can easily find it at the bottom of a diaper bag, in the trunk of my car, or in the back of the junk drawer in the kitchen (you know you all have one).I've dropped the phone.  I've taken it on water rides at Great Adventure.  It's bounced, floated and done just about anything and everything else that you can think of.  And it truly takes a licking and keeps on clicking (like how I did that?).  Great camera, great value, great bang (literally) for your buck!

Reviews.Title: So So prosuct.
Reviews.Author: Grumpy "joyrider"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the occasional beach vacation.  Used it twice already.  The second time I used it, the lens were fogging and the camera kept on prompting me to check the batteries.  No leaks but will not use it extensively in the water or it might just malfunction for good.

Reviews.Title: Doesnt work..plain and simple
Reviews.Author: Pamela P.
Reviews.Content: Please listen to this review and save some money. I spent hours and hours researching underwater cameras and this one rated highest in the under $200 range(although as you know they were all closely rated).  I went to a retailer and bought it on sale for $180. I used it the next week on the beach, the lens fogged up after underwater use (with the water safety feature completely closed), but after a full night opened up it aired out and worked fine so I kept it. Huge Mistake! Went to use it 4months later for our 2 month honeymoon in the south pacific and the screen completely fogged up after one use outside and in the water. We tried to air it out again but didn't work. I called the help line and it was very unhelpful they said if I sent it they would fix it within 6 weeks. Well, I was on vacation for another 7 weeks so this would not help me at all. I let it air out for a full week and luckily MOST of the fog went away and we could capture pictures. After another day of use more fog dissipated and it was almost normal. This is when the battery decided not to charge, even though the light was green. We found someone with a similar charger and it worked so luckily we could use our camera for a few more days while we were around them. Eventually the battery died and we tried recharging it at every hotel, and while the light lit up the camera wouldn't even turn on when we put it in the camera. We assumed it was the charger so I called to ask for a new one since it was obviously faulty and they would not send one unless I had the original receipt from 8 months ago. I used a friends fully charged battery and it didnt work, i tried our "dead" battery in hers and it was actually full, even hooked by the cord to the computer it wouldn't turn on. So somehow its a faulty camera.. no other way to put it. Our trip was not captured in pictures because of this faulty camera, please save your money and get a reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the
Reviews.Author: Ka Yeung "Fuka"
Reviews.Content: This camera is really good for its purpose that is to be used in the water. The pictures one out nice. I cannot expect professional photos out of a p&S; camera but the photos from the under water condition is good. My friends like it so much that they bought their own too.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix T waterproof camera - condensation nightmare
Reviews.Author: Edwin Barreto
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and the condensation on the viewfinder always appears.  Panasonic says that it is a normal feature but defeats the purpose of an underwater camera.  The GoPro cameras do not have this problem and my iPhone 5 with a waterproof case purchased works wonders with no condensation.  Panasonic does not want to be accountable with this design flaw and now I am stuck with a near $400 worthless camera that condensates even at the pool.GoPro is the way to go.  Panasonic, just like Best Buy, does not uphold warranty support and continues to sell defective products.  Lesson well learned.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Elton
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for it's waterproof and rugged features. After my third trip to the beach the camera took in water, I only used it in shallow water for snorkelling. I put it down for a month and it seemed to "dry out" and started working again. I now use it as I would a normal digital camera, I may risk getting it splashed but I wouldn't submerge ever again. The night pictures are not that great either, not great for high ISO pictures. Bottom line, good camera for day pictures and light water uses, not great for night pics or, from my experience, submersion.

Reviews.Title: Good for videos no much for pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Carlos Gámez
Reviews.Content: I liked the quality of the product, good for pictures in dust and water and videos, specially for videos in HD and even with sound underwater but I don't like the quality of the pictures, I have many Panasonic Lumix cameras and the quality of this is much lower that other I have.

Reviews.Title: Failed after three weeks
Reviews.Author: J. Rhodes
Reviews.Content: Situation: Caribbean cruise, water excursions, don’t want to bring my $500 DSLR or pay $1000 bucks for the waterproof casing for the DSLR.  And oh, bought an open box to reduce the price more, so may need to take my review with a grain of salt, although my experience aligns with the smaller percentage of folks with bad experiences.Research: From the reputable web sites that review cameras, there are no clear cut winners in the $300 and below water, dust, drop, etc, etc, proof cameras. There are sacrifices in design that have to be made to build a waterproof electronic camera. Your mileage is going to vary based upon expectations.  If you’re a photo hobbyist, prepare for a let down.  If you like to capture picture memories, you maybe overjoyed with the results. I lean more toward good photography results.  Out of water, the camera performed as expected and was happy with the results.  Underwater, meh… But that wasn’t all the camera’s fault (see tips).Tips: 1) Keep your camera wrapped (insulated) in your very cold cabin.  A lens that has been cooled for hours and brought out into a warm moist tropical environment is going to fog up (just like sun glasses). It’s a documented troubleshooting issue in the manual. The solution however, isn’t a quick fix.  It took the camera almost three hours to unfog, making it useless for the planned activity I had for it.  2) Expect 25% to 40% of your underwater pictures to be bad and no fault of the camera.  You’re snorkeling, have this mask on, getting pushed around by the current, bumping into people (most likely your spouse), trying to get that beautiful fish to stop moving and say “Cheese” for the camera.  You’re going to miss the fish!  Take three extra pictures for every scene you want to capture (law of probability means you might get a good picture out of the four you took).  Also, trying to preview your picture to see if you got the shot, bobbing up and down, in bright sunlight… not going to happen. You’re not going to know if you got a good picture until you get back on the bus. Prepare for the let downs, then you’ll be happy with what did turn out. 3) Buy a floating wrist strap.  It’s a pain trying to get in and out of the water from a boat with a camera on your wrist.  This camera is light, with a floating wrist strap, you can throw it into the water, get in, then swim to the camera.Performance: Here’s the let down of this camera, three days after the cruise (total ownership was three weeks), the camera failed.  I get “System Error (Zoom)”, which if you do a little research on the web seems to be more of a common occurrence.  Tried all troubleshooting recommendations in manual.  The other fix… a visit to the factory where it will cost almost the price of the camera to fix. If I had bought new vice an open box (where I wasn’t sure if the warranty was still valid), I would have sent it in.  But there are a few horror stories of the companies saying that’s not covered under warranty (dude, you’re marketing as a water proof camera) to paying for postal for the repairs (why should I have to pay for your camera failing to meet expectations). A little more research shows that sand/salt can get lodged making the camera inoperable (occurs more than not), requiring troubleshooting, i.e. soaking in fresh water to hopefully fix.  Another annoyance, Panasonic recommends soaking the camera in fresh water upon returning from a sand/salt water activity to make sure that no sand/salt gets into the battery and SD card compartment, (which may be why companies invalidate warranties cause they can claim you didn’t soak the camera in fresh water before opening and therefore sand/salt entered the camera).  Battery life was good, didn’t have a problem keeping a charge for the entire time I used it during an activity.Recommendation: Had the camera not failed after getting home from the cruise, I would have given it 3 to 4 stars.  The camera is fine out of water, and the underwater shots have exposure issues (when you can get a good shot). Not sure there is a great solution for taking great pictures underwater (other than the $1000 case for my DSLR), but we did get a few good memories with this camera before it failed.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Monhegan Joe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in August 2012.  I used it maybe three times, it was intended to be my "fishing" camera, to take pictures of fish I catch.  A month ago I found that the LCD screen had gone bad, with only 1/4 of the display working.  The camera has not been dropped or abused, it is essentially brand new.  There is no reason for the screen to go bad. I went to the Panasonic website to see about a repair, and found that the camera is out of warranty. When I submitted a request for a repair estimate, the response was $180.25.  This is hilarious, since the camera cost me $137.49 on Amazon!!!  Ridiculous.  Instead, I will buy a new, NON-PANASONIC, camera.

Reviews.Title: Many features, does what it's supposed to do!  Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Eric Doersch
Reviews.Content: It was time for our honeymoon and we were going to the West Indies.  Since we both enjoy water sports, and enjoy photography, we didn't want to leave our DSLRs on the beach when we snorkeled - we had to buy a waterproof camera that could go with us into the water.  After reading the reviews, I chose this Panasonic Lumix TS20.  It was better than I had expected, particularly in light of its price.  I'll cut to the chase:PROS:---It was waterproof as advertised.  Be careful of the rubber seal around the battery compartment - keep it free of debris.---Battery life was pretty good.  We bought an extra battery (Wasabi Power Battery, extra capacity) but rarely needed it.---20 scene modes - even a cool Tilt-shift mode (they called it Mini-effect)!---4x optical zoom.  (Didn't bother with the digital zoom.  You shouldn't either, if you care about image quality. Bad in all cameras.)---Decent image quality.  Not on par with DSLRs, but certainly acceptable, given the small lens and extra waterproofing.---HD videoCONS:---Microphone is on top of the camera.  Possible to put your finger over it, blocking the sound.  (And why doesn't it face forward?)---Panorama mode works VERY well, but the resolution is less than a normal image.  I'd have liked them bigger.We were really pleased with the camera, especially given the reasonable price.  If you're looking for a waterproof camera to take to the beach and underwater (but not too deep - see specs), this is a relatively inexpensive solution.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MisterClean
Reviews.Content: I was in a pinch to get a waterproof digital camera for a once in a lifetime vacation. More specifically I was expecting this camera to work underwater. While I'm not a camera fanatic I will say this took decent pictures underwater. What's funny was I was snorkeling and I couldn't see more than a half foot in any direction so I just randomly snapped photos. The random shots came out quite well even though they are a little greenish.This camera has been durable, slick looking, and great battery life.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: R. Scott Newth
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for underwater shots in the Galapagos.  It took very good images under and above the water.  For less than $200, it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Marin Babic
Reviews.Content: I've used it in and out of a boat, on the beach, swimming and diving a little taking pitures... You dont have to worry about it will get wet, the pictures are great in and out of the water - the only thing you have to do is wipe the lens when you take it out of the water cause the pics will be blurry...Overall great camera!

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: jorge nunez
Reviews.Content: I went on vacation and used the camera multiply times in the water it held up like a pro...... awesome picures.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Luvs2cook
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pictures and really handy to have around the pool,lake or boat. Underwater photos come out nice and easy enough to use for the kids as well

Reviews.Title: good fishing camera
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I took it to Alaska and I had no problems with it and it took good photos.  I put it under water several times but I followed the manufacturer instructions regarding maintaining its waterproof seal and had no leakage.

Reviews.Title: Worked great underwater and got completely decent pictures!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: To start, I used this camera on an eight day trip to Bermuda. It was in/under the water for at least an hour, one or two times a day, for five straight days.I hemmed and hawed for a little over a month looking at about 10 waterproof cameras for an upcoming trip to Bermuda where I planned to do a lot of snorkeling. After considering price and knowing I had a decent back-up in case this broke (an old canon point and shoot w/underwater housing), I bit the bullet and bought this camera. Unless you really mistreat this camera, I don't understand, outside of a manufacturer defect, how it becomes un-waterproofed.I tested it first in my 75 gal fish tank, letting it sit with the float strap for 30 minutes. It turned on in the tank, took pictures of my fish, and it continued to work after it was removed. No problems!I used this for snorkeling five days in a row while in Bermuda, and one day had it 1hr45min continuously (turned on the whole time, taking pictures on and off) in the water (it says it can go up to 1 hour safely). It worked like a charm. I made sure to soak it in fresh water for 10-15 min and press all the buttons (to remove salt) when I arrived back at the vacation rental (sometimes after more than an hour), shook it out, and let it sit on a washcloth to dry (all in the directions that come with the camera). I guess I babied it a bit but maybe that's why it has worked so well?I used the underwater mode so I wouldn't have to fuss with anything and most of the pictures came out fairly well, especially with favorable water conditions (crystal clear water, lots of sunlight, not a lot of sand particles).The video function worked nicely and it was quick to switch back and forth to taking still pictures. Under water, you cannot hear the motor of the zoom and it stayed in focus pretty well, I thought. Play back seems a little weird at times (too fast?) but it's all good. The colors were nice as well.I took it snorkeling at a couple shipwrecks and dove down at least 9-10ft with it, and it continued to work at that depth and when I resurfaced.The reason for the 4 stars is mostly due to the picture quality and options of the camera's features.What I disliked:-Underwater mode uses AWB which still allows too much blue and green in most pictures, they could easily fix this without having someone make a custom white balance which would be time consuming to do while in the water.-Underwater mode only uses the "standard" color mode and does not allow you to choose "vivid" like you can in Normal mode. It seems that b/c it uses AWB and AutoISO that you could just shoot in Normal mode underwater but for some reason the pictures were worse than using the specified underwater mode... at any rate, the vast majority of the underwater pictures came out a tad underwhelming in terms of color. However, because of the 16M capability, this is pretty well remedied in post-processing (if you do that)-Most of the pictures (in normal or underwater) came out very over exposed. In post-processing, I had to bring down exposures .5-1.00 full exposure to bring colors and highlights back in check. This happened moreso when taking pictures on the beach and of landscapes, but it also occurred under water.-In EVERY panorama I took, there are several vertical sections of the overall picture where the exposure has obviously changed and you can plainly see the overlap the camera made when moving the camera side to side. You'd think in panorama mode, there would be an automatic exposure lock but that does not seem to be the case. So this aspect was disappointing.-If there was not optimal lighting and optimal water quality, picture quality seemed to drop off fairly quickly. Once the light levels went below partly sunny, the noise in the underwater photos was more noticeable. I was not able to test this on land since I didn't really take any pictures outside of bright sunlight.-Burst mode (high quality, 16M) was lackluster... it was too slow to even be helpful.I will post my unprocessed pictures so people can see the sometimes lackluster color and overexposure, but also the great underwater capabilities without buying several thousand dollar professional equipment.Overall, if you take care of your equipment and need a fairly priced underwater camera, I would absolutely recommend this product. Just make sure you buy it pretty soon before you need it. That way, if it doesn't work, you will still be covered with the return policy from wherever you bought the camera. (This camera was $150 at Target when I bought it, they also have a 30-day return policy). If you post-process your images, the 16M allows a good amount of flexibility to add some more saturation and alter exposure without suffering too much in image quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but it leaks.
Reviews.Author: Agapemou
Reviews.Content: The camera took great pictures in the water. It took even better videos in the water while I was snorkeling. Everything about it was simple to understand  and operate. The problem with it is that it started leaking the third time I used it. When I opened the camera after coming out of the water snorkeling for just a few minutes there was drops of water on the battery and inside the case. I sent it back to the factory under warranty and am waiting to hear from them. I am giving it only two stars because a waterproof camera which is not  waterproof is useless.

Reviews.Title: Water resistance
Reviews.Author: S.A.A.LM "M.P.L."
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for its ability to resist  water from entering into camera structure. As far as it is producing good quality images and videos..I've seen better and I use different camera when water is not of a matter.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: William E. Strack
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter and she loves it. It takes great pictures for what it is. It is NOT a $500.00 dollar DSLR!!!! Don't expect that kind of quality. For a shoot and point camera this is very good quality and actually rivals my older Cannon Power Shot for close shoots (like out to about 50 feet). I intend to get one to take fishing and when I travel on my motorcycle tours. She did drop hers a couple of times on really hard ground and no problems. The water stays out well too. We have only used it snorkeling at about 15 feet. The underwater shots are good, assuming the water is fairly clear.

Reviews.Title: Unfortunately after three underwater outtings it leaked and stopped working period
Reviews.Author: Gregory S-S
Reviews.Content: Well, I was very excited about my first all weather camera in Feb 2013 with capabilities to be submerged up to 16ft as I am an avid outdoors person who loves the water. After a few trips to a river and waterfall where I took some amazing pictures and a frolic at a friend's pool taking pictures of my children contorting themselves underwater I went snorkeling this past Easter weekend and thought I'd take some cool underwater shots of corals and fish etc..I was in the water for about 25mins taking pictures when I saw bubbles coming out of the speaker/mic area then the screen went white and flickered. I took the camera off and came out of the water. The camera has since never recovered and I am now in the process of sending it under warranty to be repaired or replaced. I'm willing to give it another chance as the pictures prior to this failure were pretty good. Lets see how the repairs go...stay tuned.

Reviews.Title: Excelent...!
Reviews.Author: Luis Velásquez
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera. It takes amazing pictures under water. The delivery was really fast. It's an excelent choice if you want to have fun anywhere taking great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: Nikki Ryan
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for my 14 year old grandson who needed a camera to take on his 8th grade trip next spring.  I could have bought a cheapie for him, but I wanted a good, sturdy camera that could grow with him until he's an adult and can upgrade, knowing more about what he wants.  I researched cameras on Consumer Reports, etc.  I could not find the top rated camera for sale anywhere.  Then I looked at the waterproof ratings, and found this one.  I definitely wanted something sturdy, since Victor is still a kid and would probably be bouncing it around on his trip along with other places he'd take it.  I am concerned about the "waterproof" reference, since in reading the reviews I found that most people found it wasn't really waterproof.  I told Victor to never actually take it under water because of the ratings, but I was pleased that it would probably be OK in rain or water fountain sprays.  I also liked the lens set up because an extendable lens might get caught on things or open accidentally.  This again makes the camera more likely to hold up to the uses he'll give it.When he opened it on Christmas, I had charged the battery (easy to do) and also loaded an SD card (none came with the camera).  So, it was ready for use.  He seemed thrilled - he loved the orange color, tho' I had been a bit worried about that.  He knew enough about digital cameras from watching & occasionally using his parents' camera that he began taking pix right away.  He's a tinkerer, and was able to figure out how things worked pretty quickly.  I was a bit disappointed that the various buttons didn't stick up higher, and so were hard to "feel" and use without looking - that slows you down when you're taking lots of pictures, but that also means they don't stick up to catch on things that might damage the camera.  I even added a tiny book about digital cameras for dummies, and we found out his school has a camera club, so he should be a pro by the time the trip comes around.  His sister was jealous (maybe next year?), and my only disappointment was when I saw an ad at a local store 2 weeks before Christmas for the same camera, but $20 less!

Reviews.Title: Daylight only
Reviews.Author: Mark B.
Reviews.Content: I used this in a pool and on the beach and it takes great pictures during the day. However if you want it to be your only camera...The flash can not be relied on for indoor day or any nighttime photos...The quality of the images is very grainy. Not even good for facebook posting. Pretend it doesn't have a flash and just use in in a pool outside on bright days and you will be good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Zukewycz
Reviews.Content: This camera was great for the money. We took it on our cruise and it really made the trip special. We were able to take pictures in the waterfall and under the water that came out clear as day. It was easy to use and required little set up. Make sure you read the directions on cleaning and drying it after underwater use to ensure it doesn't break. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for an affordable underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED: LCD Screen destroyed by water within 20 minutes
Reviews.Author: Marti in Allen
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I am very happy to report the company honored the warranty without any hassles at all, and replaced the camera within just a few days.  The return process was easy, and the customer service was excellent.  So, if you should buy this camera and something is wrong, in my experience the company will make it right.  Therefore, I am upgrading my review from 1 star to 3 stars, and may move it to 4 stars once I try the new camera underwater.------- Original review below -----I was very careful to follow all the directions, and looked forward to some great underwater photos during a recent cruise to the Caribbean.  Sadly, the LCD screen on the back of the camera became damaged after only 20 minutes in the water. Because I could still see ghosts of images on the screen, I kept taking photos hoping that they would turn out. When we got back to the room, I rinsed the camera thoroughly in fresh water and hoped it would dry.By the second day, the "ghosted" screen began flashing off and on (like an electrical short), and the camera would take a photo only when the screen was on. However, with no other alternative, (and nothing to lose at this point) I just pointed the camera in the direction I wanted and clicked blindly, hoping that I would end up with a couple of usable images.When I got home and loaded the SD card, I was happily shocked to discover that the damage seemed to be completely limited the LCD screen.  The images themselves turned out far better than I expected - particularly since I was unable to see anything I was shooting. The flash and autofocus seemed to work fine, and the color/contrast on the images was quite acceptable for vacation photos.But without that LCD screen, the camera is basically useless -- you can't see what you are shooting without it. Because I ordered the camera from Amazon on Oct 25th rather than November 1st, I am ineligible for the extended holiday return period (next year I will delay any Q4 Amazon purchase til Nov 1st) and will have to contact the manufacturer to see if a warranty replacement is available.  To be honest, I'm not expecting much help from them, and I assuming that I've simply thrown away $180 -- but at least I managed to get a few vacation images.  If the company actually responds and honors the warranty, I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: kathansen
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our trip to the Bahamas and it worked great.  Lots of features and great picture quality. The camera did not leak when we used it.  Make sure to read the directions carefully about how to prevent water from getting in it

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater pics!
Reviews.Author: QuadChick
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a few months now, and I definitely have my likes and dislikes, but overall, this is a good camera for the price.Pros:Yes, it does work underwater and the underwater pictures are clear, even the flash works. I give it a 5 out of 5 in this area. I've only used mine in pools and water parks, so I don't know how the clarity will differ in lakes, oceans, etc. but I get several compliments on my underwater photos. The camera is also super easy to use in water and drying it just means placng it on a towel to drip dry on its own (for pool use). If your main purpose is an underwater camera, I highly recommend this one, but if you want a multipurpose camera, this may not be it.Cons:For regular pictures, the quality is a bit grainy. I've been trying several different settings and the biggest thing I am noticing in general with this camera is grainness. With the underwater pics, it's a little harder to notice, but it is definitely noticble in regular photos, especially in darker settings. However, even inside a house during the day, the photos still look a little grainy/blurry at times. It works fine outside in good lighting, but I'd say for standard use picture taking, quality is about a 3.So overall, I gave this a 4. My expectations for underwater capabilities were definitely exceeded, and as long as you remember to lock the side of the camera, you shouldn't have any water leakage.

Reviews.Title: Broke the 2nd Time I Used It
Reviews.Author: Mary Austin-Keller
Reviews.Content: So I read the reviews saying it broke the first or second time people used it and I thought it was just people didn't follow the directions. Nope. Broke on me the second time. I first tested it in the surf in San Diego and no problems. It was ready for Hawaii. I get to Hawaii and it works the first time, but starts acting funny midway through the snorkeling trip. Then the next day I go out in the water and it's not working at all, i can see water behind the screen. It was totally broken.Many thanks to Amazon for allowing me to return it. My friend bought a different one after hearing my experience and I'm waiting to see how that one works.Before it broke, though, it did take some nice pictures, although not as nice as my higher end canon point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: R. K. Martin
Reviews.Content: took it Disney last week work great not the best in low light but no cam is unless u spend lots money kids took in the water all day up and down water slides great video and pics in and out of water. the mic work really well underwater tooever night we watch the slideshow by just plugin into a TV and we had a choice of 4 music sound tracks build in to the cam also does good panorama shots too if my 6 yrs old didn't break it run up and down water slide all day it must be pretty tough cons low light but i have a $360 camera and it still has low light isuses

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Patrick S.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for our honeymoon simply for its underwater capabilities.  We had planned to take all other pictures with our iPhones, but were so happy with the quality of the pictures, we ended up using them for everything.  Great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: amasing camera
Reviews.Author: andy zuloaga
Reviews.Content: i love it this produc in very proud  for buy this camera mi kids rely enjoy go to the pool whit then

Reviews.Title: Great camera for underwater and beach!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a vacation to Kauai and the Panasonic Lumix TS20 was the perfect underwater and beach camera!  I had no trouble with water getting into the camera when snorkeling. It was great to have at the beach.  I carried it everywhere and at times the waves would come up higher than expected and the camera would get wet.  The pictures were wonderful!  I took panoramic photos of Waimea Canyon and the setting that allows you to take photos through glass worked out great on our helicopter tour of the island. I would recommend purchasing an extra battery to have charged up and on hand.  The battery did last 2-3 days with lots of picture taking.  The 16 MP allows you to print photos that you can enlarge without losing definition.  You just need to carefully follow the directions about keeping the door seal clean where the battery and SD card are located and should have no problem with leaking.  Great little camera for the price, which is much less than I paid a few months ago.  Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Takes great pics
Reviews.Author: stefan rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Just got this a few days ago and I love it.  Since I plan on bringing it out on the water on my sailboat, I got the orange so it shows up better if it goes overboard (and i like the orange).  It doesnt come with a SD card but those are pretty cheap now anyway.

Reviews.Title: great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: selazcik "LiKeDaNo"
Reviews.Content: bought for a trip to Puerto Rico.  didn't want to spend much... didn't expect such great pictures but thats exactly what i got.  great stills and great hd video.  underwater pics are amazing.  great camera for the $..even for more $

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Mountain Doc
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any issues with it so far.  Some of the learning curve in how to take video or picture has been a bit cumbersome and caused me to miss a few good shots.  Didn't test the waterproof part and hope to not have to.  The cover for the battery/SD card is where I think most are complaining about the waterproof failures and I could see it loosening/wearing out at some point.

Reviews.Title: Liked while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Jubin Jose
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for a recent trip to Cancun. Compared to my reliable point and shoot Canon SD1200IS, I liked this one since it has a decent panorama mode and quick video capture buttons is easily accessible without having to switch mode to video etc. Also relatively easy and intuitive controls to switch shooting modes.Acceptable quality for the photos I took around the beach and in the pool. Seemed to hold up pretty well until I went for snorkeling. After the first snorkel of the thee I was about to take, the unit just died on me.To Amazon's credit, they refunded the purchase and had me ship back the item.2 stars for the fact that I liked the easy controls and image+video capability of this little unit. Taking away 3 stars for the fact that the unit was not dependable. Thankfully the DicaPac which I bought from Amazon protected my regular non underwater camera and let me take pics.A lesson as to why "redundancy" in such matters is is good when you make a trip you aren't likely to make again

Reviews.Title: Fresh Pirate
Reviews.Author: Fresh Pirate!
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome underwater pictures.  It gathers enough light to make the pictures very bright.  The colors of the fish and sea life were even more beautiful in the pictures than they were in real life.  Would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: kedimarlon
Reviews.Content: OMG this camera is awesome. Please if you want an underwater camera get this one. Because it is afordable and also gets wonderful photos under the water. We always have wonderful time playing in the water and get some pictures and also videos by using this camera. Definitely suggest it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Axel
Reviews.Content: I just took this camera to Honduras for 3 weeks and it was great! The only issues is that it does not float and no one there seemed to sell camera floats, so I attached an Rx pill bottle which easily floated it.I was pretty skeptical about how it would perform, as I had been very unimpressed with a waterproof Fuji. But this camera blew me away. It took good underwater photos and great all around sunset, scenery, and action photos. The video worked great as well.Make sure to read the instructions on care and maintenance, such as washing with fresh water, making sure that dirt is not in the battery door, etc. I followed all of these instruction and never had a problem.I definitely would recommend this to family/friends.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: karent
Reviews.Content: Bought this last minute to take on a trip to Hawaii where we did a lot of snorkeling.  It did a great job taking pictures under the water...just wish I had discovered there was actually a setting for taking pictures under the water before we took all our underwater pictures!!  Even on the auto setting, though, it took great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Awesome deal!
Reviews.Author: smart shopper
Reviews.Content: This camera is really great! I am really surprised at the quality of the photos taken in and out of water. I own a digital SLR, consider myself a pretty good amateur photographer and I am picky about the quality of my photos. I live in the caribbean, and I wanted a camera take photos of when I am at the beach and snorkeling. I didn't want to risk damaging my valuable SLR by getting a camera case for it, and this camera turned out to be less expensive than the case I was considering. This camera is an awesome tool to have in the water and allows you to get angles that you cannot get with a non-waterproof camera. I have used it for a few days in a row while snorkeling and at the pool and have followed the care instructions carefully and the camera works really well. I am really pleasantly surprised at the quality of the photos. I was able to get amazing photos of a sting ray and a bunch of coral and fish. The colors are vibrant and match the ones you see in real life! The waters I typically snorkel in are crystal clear, so the images taken are actually quite impressive. If water is murky than obviously, the image will also be.For the owners of an SLR like myself, this camera is a great compliment to an SLR. It doesn't take SLR quality photos (clearly), but the quality is good enough in my opinion for amateurs like myself.For people looking to buy a point an shoot - honestly if I had to own a single point and shoot camera, this would be it. It can be used in all kinds of weather conditions (snow, heat, underwater) and the quality of the photos are very good in and out of water and the price is AMAZING. It is also very small and sleek so can be packed very easily when going on any kind of adventure. I got the floating handle for the camera when I go snorkeling with it and it works wonderfully http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003CK10DG/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i00. I would recommend getting this if you plan on using a lot in water as the camera will sink if dropped.LOVE and VERY Happy with this purchase! So excited to be able to take photos in and underwater now! My husband is not too thrilled, however, since being in water was the only time he wasn't forced to pose for photos! ha!

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Melissa Coakley
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take to Mexico because I knew I would be doing a lot of swimming/snorkeling in the ocean (looking for sea turtles). I wanted a good water camera and I thought I researched the cameras enough!  I really didn't want to pay more than $200 since I already have a great camera.  So, this camera worked okay and took pretty decent photos (nothing super clear) for the first two days of the trip.  Then all the sudden there was a lens error and the camera would only stay on for maybe 30 seconds or so.  The good news is I was still able to take a photo or two before the camera shut off.  But, I would have to turn it on again every time I wanted to take a photo.  The quality of the photos at that point were not very good (sort of foggy looking).  So, I relied on this camera for the underwater portion of my trip and was sorely disappointed.  I am really glad that I had my regular camera with me too.The problem that occurred with this camera doesn't seem related to underwater use.  I returned the camera and am still trying to find a suitable replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: Jean Evatt
Reviews.Content: Finally got to use this "daily deal" on our recent trip to Jamaica & it worked great! Easy to use both in the water & on land, just got to remember to hold it along the edges or you have some new views of your fingers!! Took several videos while snorkeling & they came out really well, just make sure you don't point the camera towards the surface/sun as that was a problem for us, its just too bright! All in all for our first waterproof camera we are very happy with the ease of use, price & quality of photos & video. We followed the instructions included with the camera about its care after being in the water & had no problems. We also purchased the Chum floater in case we dropped it in the water & that worked great too! The only thing we wished we had purchased before our trip was extra memory as the videos do take up a lot of it, but that was our own fault. We would definitely recommend this little gem!

Reviews.Title: Best decision ever!!!
Reviews.Author: jcas
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of so many different waterproof/underwater cameras, we settled on this Panasonic.  Great Choice!!  I research everything to death before I make a decision, so I feel like this was a definite homerun!  We took this camera to Belize in September and used it in the pool and in the ocean...every picture we took underwater or on land came out better then I anticipated.  It's easy to just follow the directions when you have this camera in the water...I had no issues whatsoever the whole trip.  Absolutely recommend this Panasonic Lumix TS20 if you are looking for a reliable waterproof camera that fits any budget.

Reviews.Title: The picture was cropped.
Reviews.Author: Enrique
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera trough Amazon, and once I charged the battery and I used it for the first time I realized that the pictures I took had a black strip under the picture. I really don't know what might be causing this but after trying to power it off and on and calling Panasonic for support: they had no idea what happened to the camera they just told me to send it back for an RMA which I didn't because I didn't want to get the same camera plus I received the camera a day before a trip (not complaining about shipping, that part worked perfectly, thank you Amazon) so I couldn't just wait for this RMA. I decided to ask return the camera to Amazon and I just bought the TS3 from Panasonic at a Duty Free shop at the airport. It worked flawlessly and believe me I asked them to turn it on before buying it so I could check that it didn't have the black strip!If you are looking for a great adventure camera and  waterproof camera with a very good picture quality, I can recommend the TS3 from Panasonic, it's a bit more pricey but totally worth it: I even lost it for half an hour at the bottom of a lake and found it after quite some time of swimming and it was like nothing had happened! I mean how many times can you say that your camera can stay easily for half an hour under the water at the bottom of a lake (about 3 meters deep)! That's just awesome!Here's the link for the TS3: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 12.1 MP Rugged/Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: KMM
Reviews.Content: After going on snorkeling trips with only a waterproof one-time-use camera to capture everything, I really wanted to buy a waterproof camera for an upcoming vacation to Belize. The  main things that I was looking for was that it had to be sturdy, with as many MegaPixels as possible without being super expensive. I researched and compared a number of cameras and spent a lot of time reading customer reviews before deciding that this was the best quality with the most affordable price.At first the reviews about this camera breaking after one use in the water made me hesitate but it worked perfectly during our trip! I would highly recommend reading the care instructions about soaking it in water after using it in saltwater, not going further than 16 feet and not keeping it submerged in saltwater for too long. I followed the care directions and I think this camera is going to last for many more snorkeling trips.  I got some fantastic, clear shots of marine life and the zoom was great too! The camera worked so well that we even used it on land to take some photos while we were hiking to see the Mayan ruins.I highly recommend this camera if you want a simple, affordable waterproof camera!

Reviews.Title: Leaked first time out
Reviews.Author: M. Bannister
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for an extended vacation with my husband. Unfortunately, the camera leaked the first time it was in the water. Never was in sand, triple-checked to make sure the door was shut properly and locked. Didn't even last an hour of snorkeling.Waiting to hear from Panasonic now. I'd prefer to just return it to Amazon but we got home 8 days after the return period ended. If I get no satisfaction from Panasonic, I'll return it for a partial refund and call it an expensive lesson.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in optical quality of pics
Reviews.Author: MT "Mythman"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to replace a Pentax Optio W-30 I had used for years while kayak fishing.  I am very disappointed in the quality of the pictures while the camera is on Auto.  Way too dark or too light, blurred pictures and just generally not the quality I am use to.  I am trying to compensate for this by using the manual adjustments.  We shall see......................it is so bad, I am looking at other cameras, already.I, also, do not like where the lens is located, I frequently have pics with my finger showing.  I am having to relearn how to hold a camera.............but that is a personal thing.Unless I can get some acceptable pics (and I am not a professional and don't have to have perfect pics), I will most probably get another waterproof camera and sell this one for whatever I can get out of it.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed. Tough and true to description.
Reviews.Author: Zac Cunningham
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a whitewater rafting trip. This little trooper spent most of it's time in the bottom of the raft getting stepped on, submerged in water, hit with paddles, and generally being abused. It was always ready to go when I needed it.A few things to note would be:-At first I was skeptical about the battery/memory card door being a little flimsy, but it has a double locking mechanism and held tight no matter what we threw at it.-Camera turns on very fast. It only takes 1 second to go from completely off to ready to take a picture/video.-Takes great pictures in and out of water. The anti-shake and auto focus work great, even in high-intensity situations. (other waterproof cameras at this price level I have used have been lacking on features and not very good out of the water, but NOT the Lumix.)- The separate shutter buttons for picture and video come in very handy, no need to mess with the menus. Spend more time looking at the scenery and enjoying yourself and less time fiddling with equipment.- Camera DOES NOT FLOAT. I recommend purchasing a flotation strap, or make your own by cutting off about 3 inches of a pool noodle and tying that to the existing strap.- The Lumix is also temperature resistant hot or cold, but I have not tested this yet. It has special settings for pictures in snow.In summary, at this price level this piece of equipment goes above and beyond surpassing my already high expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive camera with waterproof protection
Reviews.Author: Paul Richardson "adguy"
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th digital camera in 2 years.  My $300 Nikon was damaged when daughters 5 year old friend dropped it, my $300 Canon stopped working on a Caribbean vacation due to high humidity (do not buy a Canon and use near salt water and heat), my new $300 Nikon died after an unexpected roll over in a kayak.  Given that I was into digital cameras for close to $1,000 in just over a year I decided to go with a waterproof, drop resistant design and this $130 Lumix easily produces photos equal in quality to the Canon and Nikon's costing several hundred dollars more.  The downsides are the lack of optical zoom and extreme close ups but it will still take a sharp photo from 12" in good light.  I highly recommend this bullet proof bargain camera.

Reviews.Title: Snorkel Away!
Reviews.Author: TakesWayTooManyPictures
Reviews.Content: This cam is amazing. I bought it specifically for my vacation to Hawaii, and it did not disappoint. I took underwater shots of fish and people and although they weren't amazing HD quality, they were still awesome pictures, and my cam is still here to live another day! Great find, not too expensive and does exactly what it claims. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Gives your photos a whole different perspective......
Reviews.Author: Thomas Hybiske
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera just prior to leaving for a vacation to the Jersey shore.  With sand, surf, and pool, I wanted to be able to take a camera to the beach and not worry about getting sand or salt water on it.  This little camera was just the answer.  We stuck it in the pocket of our beach cart, not worrying about it at all.  I carried it in the ocean and took both stills and videos of the our grandkids.  All of our prior pictures have always been on the beach, with the kid's backs the camera.  Now I could go out in the surf and take pictures looking at the kids.  It gave a completely different perspective.  Back at the pool, I shot a number of underwater stills and videos of our own Little Mermaid.  The camera performed flawlessly.  I got a kick out of the stares and comments of the people both in the ocean and pool as I ducked the camera repeatedly under water.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot to have fun!
Reviews.Author: LudvigM
Reviews.Content: My previous point and shoot camera was broken just before our holidays to I decided to get a new one. As I have a DSRL camera for the "good" pics I gave this one a try for the fun pictures. I've never have an underwater camera before (not even the disposable ones) so it took me a while to decide to put it under water... So glad I did! We got really nice and funny pictures in the hotel pool, and in the sea. We went to a dolphins encounter where they only recommend water proof cameras and get some other nice too. Our little orange not only give us a lot of underwater fun but also provided a lot of great ones outside, specially with good light! It also has a lot of menu options and settings. Very Complete!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: rmc
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera several times and it works great.  I took it tubing down the river(I even had it in a cooler for a period of time), swimming at the pool, and outside/inside dry pictures.  All have turned out well.  I would recommend this product for an easy point and shoot camera with the added feature of being waterproof. The only thing that super annoying is each time I turn on the camera it wants me to read the warnings about water and correct use...it's easy to bypass reading the warning but I just wish it wouldn't show up at all. I am sure if I took the time to read the manual I could figure out how to turn it off but that sounds like too much work! Buy it- it's great! Oh and remember- IT DOES NOT COME WITH A MEMORY CARD so I just used the card from my DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Blue Dragonfly Designs
Reviews.Content: This is the easiest digital cameras to learn that I've ever tried. The functionality and results are excellent. The 'panoramic' feature is alot of fun.It's been a joy to use.

Reviews.Title: A perfect camera to take along kayking & hiking
Reviews.Author: ScoSny
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my last digital camera fell out of my life jacket & into the river I was kayaking on. I really enjoy this camera because I do not have to worry about it getting wet. I added a camera neck strap so it can not get too far away from me. The picture quality is excellent. The camera is small for my big hands but very sturdy. It is so light that I forget it is around my neck. A perfect camera for someone who enjoys the outdoors & wants a few pictures to remember it by.

Reviews.Title: Great affordable camera
Reviews.Author: Nathan R. Schwartz
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great little camera. It is about the size of a wallet and easily fits in my pocket. It turns on fast and is ready for videos or pictures in seconds. It does have a slight delay when taking photos, but it does have a burst mode to take a bunch of photos together. I would recommend burst if you want to catch action. It has face recognition for face focusing, sephia and a host of other modes. The most amazing thing is the underwater shots. You can take pictures and video with sound underwater! It sounds like the movies, and will be amazing, if I were in the ocean rather than a swimming pool... I wish I had this camera at the beach last year! A few months ago my old camera was destroyed at an amusement park when a wave suddenly splashed me. This camera is perfect, waterproof to 5 meters, drop proof 5 feet and cold and dust proof. It even has a vacation setting that can change the time for a pre-determined date range so when you are on vacation, the camera will have the correct date/time. It is the perfect, portable vacation anything camera.

Reviews.Title: Lumix underwater camra review
Reviews.Author: mejo14
Reviews.Content: I purchased this low priced camera for use on a recent trip to St Kitts.  For the price I thought that the underwater pictures and video were far superior to the disposable underwater cameras that I have used in the past.  Frankly they were much better then I had expected especially the underwater video.  The zoom was not as good as my canon that I use for dry conditions.  I also used it to video a zip lining trip and the still pictures were great.  The beginning of the video was very good but the zoom could not keep up with the speed of the zip lines which was not really suprising due to the speed and acceleration of the lines.  My only complaint is the lack of a short guide to allow you to take with you when you travel.  Most of the directions are on a CD and thus you would need to have a laptop with you.  Overall I thought the camera was a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Chris Olson
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few weeks now, and during that time have put it through a fair amount of abuse.  I've dropped it in hot tubs, submerged it in rivers, and rinsed it off in the sink.  (All mostly fresh water).Using a Trascend SDHC 8Gb card currently.Pros:- Compact- Fairly lightweight- Fast processing/saving of pictures- Waterproof to the specs noted in item description.  Haven't tried it deeper or in salt water.- Case can take a few dents with no issues internally- Large viewscreen on back of cameraCons:- Zoom.  It's good if you're fairly close to the subject, but the digital zoom isn't the greatest.- Camera can get somewhat slick (when wet).  Highly suggest using the wrist strap or attaching some form of grip (e.g. supergluing some kind of rough contact paper) to various parts of camera to help prevent slippage.Overall:Solid little travel camera.  If you're looking for something to take to the waterpark, beach, or river to get close up shots of your friends/family/general landscape, this model's worth considering (moreso if you're on a budget).

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Cooler
Reviews.Content: So far, so good.  I got this camera after my wife had dropped her other camera in the pool.  I thought that this may be a good choice.  I normally go with a Sony (which I still find to be a better camera for point and shoot), but this camera has a lot of options including panoramic shooting.  All in all, this is a really nice camera and the waterproof and shock proof bring it to 4 stars for me.

Reviews.Title: It works!
Reviews.Author: Pdxman
Reviews.Content: I hardly ever write reviews, but for the $119 I spent it was good deal worth reporting.  Though I haven't had it long, I've been very impressed by good pics and that it actually works well under water.  It's hard to see the screen under water, but I've had pretty good luck getting my subject in the frame.  Unless you need something high-end, I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: a decent camera
Reviews.Author: gunn
Reviews.Content: positive things about this camera:- starts and shoots really fast, so that you wouldn't miss anything.- battery life is excellent- very light- the functions are easy to understand, thus it's good for elder peoplenegative things:- no matter how big storage you have, it does not record a video longer than 30 minutes- panorama image is very poor- it always flashes a light even when the flash is set off, so you can't take a picture unnoticed.

Reviews.Title: VERY FUN
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "De"
Reviews.Content: Only have had camera for 2weeks. Used it in the pool for maybe 3hours....WORKED GREAT!! With 2 teens always checking every photo, battery lift NOT so good. You really need 2 batteries (buy another today).UPDATE:I've had this camera for 6months now. It's STILL GREAT! I have gotten 2 extra batteries (1 bat about 5hours, I us 2 every time I use it). This camera has been in a the tub, sink, puddle, 3 pools, rain, mud, snow, pond, beach, lake & ocean...more than once. It has also been dropped, banged & bumped. It still LOOKS & WORKS GREAT!!! It's easy to use! Photo are ok underwater...but they get better the more you play with camera (get close). Pool photo look best because the water is CLEAN. Photos not in water are normale photos. If you want a JUST-FOR-FUN camera or a beach camera....this is it. You'll have also of fun OR you're kids and there friends will have a BLAST wit this camera. If I only let me kid use it...IT'S WORTH IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: M. Hanf "mr mudpie"
Reviews.Content: Average camera.  The pics are sometimes great, sometimes average.  The cord that comes with it to attach to your pc is very short.I like the size, it fits right in my pocket while I am kayaking.

Reviews.Title: Great for vacation!
Reviews.Author: eliza
Reviews.Content: We went on vacation in Costa Rica. PERFECT CAMERA! I can't imagine going without it. We were able to take fantastic pictures in the ocean, on an ATV tour, and in the rain. The picture quality is what you pay for. Overall, I'm so happy we got it. It takes the worry out of taking a camera somewhere.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: gregwc1
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for a upcoming cruise after much research. We took it to the beach, snorkeling, and in some of the towns we stopped in. I was pleasantly surprised after I returned home and downloaded the pics and videos to my computer. The videos are excellent in hd, puts my old canon to shame.
